Text: Another Dredger has landed on Mars
Translation: 另一架挖掘機已降落在火星上
離群無人機正在發動攻擊！

Text: Number Six has sabotaged the Explorer
Translation: 六號已經破壞了探索者
治療藥物已出口至地球！

Text: The crystals are merging into a single entity
Translation: 多個水晶正在融合為單個整體

Old Translation: 獲得<research(points)>
幽光已分析

Text: Trigger a meteor shower that will yield some valuable resources – Metals, Rare Metals and Anomalies. The meteor shower falls over a random location and may threaten the colony.
Translation: 引發一場隕石風暴，該風暴會產出一些珍貴資源，如金屬、稀有金屬和異象。隕石風暴襲擊一個隨機地點，可能會威脅到殖民地。
Old Text: Trigger a meteor shower that will yield some valuable resources – Metals, Rare Metals and Anomalies. The meteor shower falls over a random location and may threaten the colony.
Old Translation: 引發一場隕石風暴，該風暴會產出一些珍貴資源，如金屬、稀有金屬和異象。隕石風暴襲擊一個隨機地點，可能會威脅到殖民地。

Text: Increase sponsor research in exchange for constructing and launching an advanced communications satellite.
Translation: 建造並發射一枚先進通訊衛星以換取更多贊助者研究點數。

Text: Grants Funding. Multiple uses of this project will yield diminishing returns.
Translation: 獲得資金多次使用此工程會導致收益遞減。
發射外星智慧生命搜尋衛星

Text: Generates Funding by doing on-site research for third-party contractors.
Translation: 為第三方承包商進行現場研究以產生資金。

Text: Highly abnormal weather patterns in this area prove there is still a lot we don’t know about Mars. Investigating the site could bring on a breakthrough.
Translation: 這個區域極端異常的氣候規律證明我們對火星依然知之甚少。對此地展開調查或許能發現一項突破性技術。

Text: Observing the anomalous area brings the promise of either groundbreaking research, or the serious need to fix our observation instruments.
Translation: 調查異常區域可能為我們帶來突破性技術，也可能意味著我們的觀測儀器急需修理。

Text: This place is just weird. There is obviously something very wrong about our understanding of the planet and this particular area doesn’t give a damn.
Translation: 這地方也太詭異了。我們對這顆星球的理解顯然存在著嚴重偏差，而這塊區域根本不在乎這一點。

Text: A mysterious signal caught from this area is speculated to come from the remnants of a lost and secretive science mission.
Translation: 我們在這個區域捕獲到的訊號據推測是從一處失聯的祕密科學代表團的遺蹟裡發出的。

Text: This area registered off-the-charts readings for a while now. This prompts an expedition.
Translation: 這個區域的異常讀數已經持續一陣子了。我們應該派遣一支探險隊。

Text: One-off strange readings usually don't merit much attention. This one is too weird to be a sensor glitch.
Translation: 一次性的怪異讀數往往不會引起太多注意。這個讀數太詭異了，不可能是感應器故障。

Text: Multiple strange signals, detected over time, can all be traced to this area. It is now nicknamed "The Zone".
Translation: 一段時間內發現的多處怪異訊號都指向這個區域。現在我們給它取了個外號叫“神祕地帶”。

Text: Something interesting seems to be going on here. On Mars many interesting things can get you killed.
Translation: 這裡似乎正在發生很有意思的事。在火星上，很多有意思的事往往能要你的命。

Text: We have visuals of a large crater. Thе meteorite that formed it was composed of metallic iron-nickel material. Someone suggested that we use some of it to forge a sword and name it.
Translation: 我們看到了一個大型隕石坑。形成該隕石坑的隕石由鐵鎳類金屬物質構成。有人提議我們用隕石的一部分金屬物質鍛造一把劍，並給它取個名字。

Text: Satellites have located an iron-rich region where pieces of hematite and other useful minerals can just be picked from the ground! One only needs robot patience to do that.
Translation: 衛星發現了一處富含鐵資源的地點。在該地點，赤鐵和其他有用的礦物甚至不用開採就能直接拿走！只需要機器人一樣的耐心就夠了。

Text: We have discovered an open vein of hematite ore. It seems we can send an expedition to mine it even without heavy equipment.
Translation: 我們發現了一處露天赤鐵礦脈。我們似乎可以派一支沒有攜帶重型裝置的探險隊前去搜集。

Text: Satellite observations discovered a region of dark sand dunes containing chromite, magnetite and ilmenite. We just need to send an expedition to scoop them up.
Translation: 衛星觀測發現了一處含有鉻鐵礦、磁鐵礦和鈦鐵礦的暗色沙丘區域。我們只需要派一支探險隊去搜集這些資源。

Text: Readings suggest that this small black bump could actually be an obsidian-rich mountain.
Translation: 讀數顯示這個小黑塊實際上可能是一座富含黑曜石的山。

Text: A recent dust storm revealed the crash site of what is believed to be a polymer shipment gone missing a while back.
Translation: 最近一次沙塵暴過後，我們發現了一批之前不知所蹤的聚合物。

Text: Satellite screening has highlighted a promising crater from a carbonaceous meteorite containing polymers. We just need to send a rocket to pick it up.
Translation: 衛星調查發現了一處由含有聚合物的碳質隕石形成的隕石坑。我們只需要發射一枚火箭去搜集資源。

Text: A spectrographic sweep of the location caught telltale signs of fluorine - a crystal used in the manufacturing of durable polymers.
Translation: 對該地區進行攝譜儀掃描後，我們發現了氟。這種晶體可用來製作耐用的聚合物。

Text: Planetary scanning discovered an inactive volcano that may provide valuable insight about the plate tectonics on Mars. Several millions of years ago this was the perfect place to throw a ring into.
Translation: 行星掃描發現了一座死火山。該火山或許能在火星地殼板塊構造方面給我們提供寶貴的見解。幾百萬年前，這裡是把戒指丟下去的絕佳地點。

Text: Rapidly shifting sands in the area present conditions fit for multipurpose research experiments.
Translation: 此地區快速移動的沙子表明這裡的條件很適合進行用途多樣的研究實驗。

Text: Sinkholes appear here in a rate seen nowhere else on Mars. Scientific potential warrants sending a vehicle.
Translation: 此地形成天坑的速度在火星上其他地方前所未見。我們有必要派一輛載具調查此地蘊藏的科學可能性。

Text: A huge water lake residing beneath a relatively thin sheeting of ice is what every scientist – geologists being an exception – will call a gold mine.
Translation: 一座藏在相對較薄的冰層下的巨型淡水湖對所有科學家（地質學家除外）而言，都是一座金礦。

Text: Glimmering salts in the area baffle our scientists. Sending a rocket filled with some baffled scientists could prove beneficial.
Translation: 該區域閃閃發光的鹽粒令科學家們困惑。派困惑的科學家們乘坐火箭前往該地或許能幫助他們解開謎團。

Text: A regular satellite sweep located a gold vein literary lying on the ground! It inspired a gold rush, as everyone wants to “dig the treasure” as soon as possible.
Translation: 常規衛星掃描發現了一處地表金礦脈！該礦脈引發了淘金潮。人人都想儘快“挖出寶藏”。

Text: A regular satellite sweep located an easily exploitable deposit of rare metals.
Translation: 常規衛星掃描發現了一處容易開採的稀有金屬資源點。

Text: We have located a quite unusual meteorite crater. It seems that the meteorite which created it was composed mainly of precious metals!
Translation: 我們發現了一處十分不尋常的隕石坑。形成該隕石坑的隕石的主要成分似乎是貴重金屬！

Text: Spectrographic analyses revealed a ground cavity which seems to contain a huge deposit of precious metals. We can send an RC Commander to enter it and gather the treasure. Mission Control insisted that we name the rover “Siegfried”.
Translation: 攝譜儀分析發現了一處地洞，裡面藏有儲量豐富的貴重金屬資源點。我們可以派遣一輛遙控指揮車進去搜集寶藏。任務指揮中心堅持要我們將那輛探測車命名為“齊格弗裡德”。

Text: An unidentified robotic rover roams the sands in this area. Reaching it could secure us precious knowledge.
Translation: 一輛不明機器人探測車在此地區的沙漠中漫遊。若將其捕獲，我們可獲得寶貴的知識。

Text: Previous observations tell of a rainbow having being sighted at this spot – most probably from crystalizing water vapors. Scientists are quite vocal of the interest the area represents.
Translation: 之前的觀測在此地發現了彩虹，很可能是由正在結晶的水蒸氣產生的。科學家們明確表示對該區域很感興趣。

Text: Geological murmurs heard by our most sensitive equipment pinpoint an area of immense scientific interest.
Translation: 我們最敏感的裝置接收到微弱的地質訊號後，確定了一處擁有巨大科學價值的地點。

Text: This location is believed to be the site of a secretive military experiment from decades ago. Rummaging through the sands here could yield some technological insights.
Translation: 據信，此地點是幾十年前祕密軍事實驗基地的遺址。在此處的沙中或許能翻找出技術知識。

Text:
Through the devotion and self-sacrifice of our Colonists and your vision and leadership, Commander, the dream has come true. 
Thanks to you, humanity has a new future, a new path to follow.
Translation:
透過殖民地居民的奉獻和自我犧牲，以及指揮官你的遠見卓識和英明領導，我們的夢想成真了。
多虧了你，人類擁有了全新的未來和方向。

Text: In the beginning, it was just a dream - setting foot on another planet, surviving it, building a new future for humanity.
Translation: 起初，踏上別的行星，在上面生存並為人類建設全新的未來僅僅是個夢想。

Text:
Even the tiniest, simple-looking rock can contain the answers to mysteries which perplexed the human mind for generations. Sometimes it takes just a simple discovery to assure us of the vastness of the Universe, an encouragement to make us look beyond the boundaries of our existence and into the future.

<effect> The following Techs have been revealed on the Research screen:
<list_text>
Translation:
即使是最小最不起眼的石頭裡都有可能藏著人類歷史上不解之謎的答案。有時候，我們只要稍加探索，就能對宇宙浩瀚無邊這一事實確信無疑。在這一事實的激勵下，我們開拓自身認知的邊界，並放眼未來。

<effect>下列科技已經顯示在研究介面上：
<list_text>

Text: There's more to the barren environs of the Red Planet than meets the eye - a veritable treasure trove of undiscovered knowledge and wonder… So long as you know where to look.
Translation: 這顆紅色星球並非只是一塊不毛之地。只要你找對地方，就會發現這裡還藏著貨真價實的寶藏以及未被發現的知識與奇景。

Text:
Many of the colony buildings require Concrete for their construction. Due to the heavy weight of the material continuous imports from Earth are not practical in the long run and we have to secure its production in the colony.

Concrete extractors must be placed over or within proximity to sulfur-rich regolith deposits. Like many other colony buildings, concrete extractors will require Power and regular maintenance from Drones.
Translation:
建造殖民地裡很多建築物時都要用到混凝土。由於這種材料很重，一直從地球進口並非長久之計。我們得想辦法在殖民地裡出產這種資源。

混凝土挖掘站必須放置在富含硫磺的風化層資源點上或附近。混凝土挖掘站和殖民地裡很多其他建築一樣，需要電力和無人機的定期維護。
推薦建築：混凝土挖掘站

Text: Commander, did you know that you can open the Build Menu with or ? This is quicker and more efficient than using the HUD button.
Translation: 指揮官，你知道嗎？你可以用或開啟建造選單。 這比使用面板按鈕快速高效得多。

Text: Back on Earth, a dutiful team is standing by for our call. In mere hours they can prepare a new Rocket or Supply Pod and fill it with whatever resources we request, within the limits of the funding provided by our sponsor. Don’t hesitate to make the call and secure valuable resources which we still can’t produce ourselves, or we are deprived of on the surface of the Red Planet. You can open the Resupply screen from the menu and order a new Rocket or Supply Pod with resources, buildings and vehicles from Earth.You can open the Resupply screen from the HUD button and order a new Rocket or Supply Pod with resources, buildings and vehicles from Earth. Resupply missions can be used as long as you have Funding to order a payload from Earth. Supply Pods cost extra, but Rockets will require refueling for the return trip.
Translation: 地球上一個盡職盡責的團隊正在等待著我們的召喚。他們能在幾小時內準備好一艘細心火箭或補給艙，並在我們贊助者所提供的資金允許的範圍內準備好我們所需的資源。不要猶豫，立刻召喚他們以獲取一些我們尚無法自己生產的，或是無法從火星表面獲取到的貴重資源。 您可以從選單開啟重新補給介面，然後從地球預定一艘裝有資源、建築和載具的新火箭或補給艙。您可以點選HUD按鈕開啟重新補給介面並從地球預定一艘裝有資源、建築和載具的新火箭或補給艙。 只要您有資金預定地球上的貨物，您就可以使用重新補給任務。補給艙價格更高，但火箭需要補充燃料才能飛回去。

Old Text: Resupply Rockets
Old Translation: 重新補給火箭

Text: Mission Control suggests that we order a Rocket or Supply Pod with valuable payload from Earth. We still need all the help we can get to survive the harsh environment of the Red Planet.
Translation: 任務指揮中心建議我們從地球預定一艘裝有珍貴物資的火箭或補給艙。為了在火星的惡劣環境中生存，我們仍需要一切可以得到的幫助。
Old Text: Mission Control suggests that we order a rocket with valuable supplies from Earth. We still need all the help we can get to survive the harsh environment of the Red Planet.
Old Translation: 任務指揮中心建議我們從地球預定一艘裝有貴重補給品的火箭。我們仍然需要能讓我們在火星的惡劣環境中生存的所有幫助。

Text:
Sol <day> of our mission will be remembered. Our greatest project to date has been completed – the Dome is ready to harbor the first Colonists on Mars. We, the team at Mission Control, are honored to be among the ones chosen to mark the beginning of a new age.

We created a place for humanity to call home, a place which reminds us of Earth. The Dome seems so fragile, like a glittering snow globe resting among the red sands. This makes us wonder – will our future be just as fragile? Would we be able to leave our cradle and thrive on this cold, distant world?
Translation:
人們將永遠銘記我們任務的第<day>個太陽日。我們完成了迄今為止最偉大的工程：穹頂已經準備好接收火星殖民地的首批居民。身處任務指揮中心的我們很榮幸能成為新時代開闢者中的一員。

我們為人類創造了一個令人回想起地球的新家園。穹頂看起來就像放置在紅色沙漠中的一枚閃亮雪球一樣脆弱。這令我們不禁猜測：人類的未來是否也如此脆弱呢？我們能否離開搖籃，在這個遙遠的寒冷星球上發展壯大呢？

Text: It's been a stellar day. Not just for the mission, but for humanity itself.
Translation: 不管是對這次任務還是人類本身而言，今天都具有里程碑意義。

Text: Are you sure you want to cancel the Rocket’s launch order?
Translation: 是否確定取消火箭發射命令？

Text:
Failure's just another step in the process. The only thing is to dust ourselves off and try again. And when the future generations return to Mars, our experience, our mistakes and achievements will help them succeed where we could not.

<effect> All Founders have either died or left Mars. The Colony couldn't live up to the dream of human colonization. Game over. But don't give up!
Translation:
每失敗一次，我們就離最後的成功近了一步。我們只需要振作起來再試一次。我們的子孫後代將來返回火星時，我們的經驗、錯誤與成就將幫助他們取得我們沒能取得的成功。

<effect>所有創始者都已亡故或已離開火星。殖民地沒能實現人類的殖民夢想。遊戲結束。但不要放棄！

Text: Humanity had such high hopes and we failed them. We failed the Founders. But is this really the end?
Translation: 人類滿懷希望，但我們辜負了他們。我們辜負了創始者們。但一切真的就這麼結束了嗎？

Text:
Now, our goal as a species is to not despair. To not look away from the stars. The path has proven to be hard and rocky, but hardship had only made humans more determined – and that’s what defines us as a species! We are sure that one day people will walk the red sands and call Mars their home.

<effect> All Colonists have either died or left Mars. Game over. But don't give up!
Translation:
現在，我們人類絕不能心灰意冷。要繼續放眼星空。這條路崎嶇難行，但艱難困苦只會使人類的決心更加堅定，而這也是我們人類的偉大之處！我們堅信，有朝一日人們會踏上這顆紅色星球，並在火星上安家。

<effect>所有殖民地居民都已亡故或已離開火星。遊戲結束。但不要放棄！

Text: The Colony has failed. The lives and the dreams of our Colonists are lost, washed away by despair and grief.
Translation: 殖民地失敗了。我們殖民地居民的夢想破滅，客死他鄉，只剩下悲痛與絕望。

Text:
A Dust Storm is set to hit the colony soon. It will cause damage to Pipes and Cables and also will place a serious strain on all buildings – pushing them towards needing maintenance sooner than usual. 

Stocking up on Power, Water and Oxygen in batteries and tanks is a wise precaution. Disabling non-vital buildings that consume these resources prior and during a Dust Storm will help get by on the available reserves. 

The following buildings do not function during Dust Storms:
- MOXIEs
- Moisture Vaporators
- Solar Panels outside Domes
Translation:
一場沙塵暴即將襲擊殖民地。它對管道和電纜造成損害，同時也會對所有建築物造成嚴重的壓力，迫使它們比平時更早地需要維護。 

在電池和容器中儲存電力、水和氧氣是明智的預防措施。在沙塵暴前和期間關閉消耗這些資源的不重要建築將有助於依靠這些可用儲備生存。 

以下建築物在沙塵暴期間無法運作：
- 氧氣生成裝置
- 水氣蒐集站
- 穹頂外的太陽能板

Text:
The region is about to experience a Meteor Storm. Buildings directly hit by meteors will be in need of repairs in order to function again while Pipes and Cables will get destroyed. Rovers hit by meteors will also need repairs while Drones may become irreversibly damaged. 

Meteor Storms cannot be avoided but some good practices may minimize their damage potential, such as not clustering vital buildings next to each other, Pipe and Cable redundancy and researching the tech for MDS Lasers from the Physics field.
Translation:
此區域即將經歷隕石風暴。被隕石直接擊中的建築物將需要維修，以便在管道和電纜被破壞的情況下再次發揮作用。隕石擊中的探測車也需要修理，而無人機可能會受到不可挽回的破壞。 

隕石風暴無法避免，但一些好的做法可以儘可能減少風暴的破壞潛力，如不把重要的建築物聚集在一起，設定管道和電纜冗餘，並從物理學領域研究反隕石鐳射炮的技術。

Text:
A Cold Wave is imminent. While most of our machinery is designed and able to function in such low temperatures, if a building outside stops working for more than a Sol, it will freeze and may not be repaired until after the Cold Wave has lifted.

Cold Waves put an extra strain on the electrical grid and buildings will consume more electricity. One way to negate the effects of a Cold Wave is to place Subsurface Heaters (researched from the Physics field) near vulnerable buildings.

The following buildings will freeze during a Cold Wave:
- Water Tanks
- Outside buildings that are not operational for more than a Sol
Translation:
寒流即將來臨。雖然我們大多數機器的設計能夠在這樣的低溫下運作，但是如果外面的建築物停止運作超過一個太陽日，建築物就會凍結，並且直到寒流結束之後才可予以修理。

寒流會給電網帶來額外的壓力，所有建築物都會消耗更多的電力。有一種方法可以消除寒流的影響，即，將地下加熱器（從物理領域研究）置於易受寒流影響的建築物附近。

在寒流期間，以下建築物會被凍結：
- 水箱
- 停止運作超過一個太陽日的外部建築物

Text: Although this is a controlled operation, the exact impact locations are outside our control and may endanger our colony.
Translation: 儘管這是一次我們策劃的行動，但我們無法控制準確的撞擊地點，我們的殖民地可能會有危險。

Text: We have succeeded in capturing and diverting meteors towards our general vicinity in a gambit to bring precious resources and even scientific insight withing our reach.
Translation: 我們成功捕獲了隕石，並將其轉向了我們大致的位置附近，目的是讓珍貴的資源甚至科學發現出現在離我們很近的地方。
Old Text: We have succeeded in capturing and diverting meteors towards our general vicinity in a gambit to bring precious resources and even scientific insight withing hands reach.
Old Translation: 我們成功捕獲了隕石，並將其轉向了我們大致的位置附近，目的是讓珍貴的資源甚至科學發現出現在離我們很近的地方。

Text: The resulting speed at which data is now transferred makes everyone wonder how we got anything done before.
Translation: 現在資料傳輸速度令大家不禁琢磨我們之前是怎麼熬過來的。

Text: Our high-speed Comm Satellite is now online.
Translation: 我們的高速通訊衛星已上線。

Text: It is now operational and will contribute towards the decades old mission of finding signs of intelligent life elsewhere in the galaxy.
Translation: 它現在已正常運轉，並會對已有幾十年歷史的銀河系外星智慧生命跡象搜尋任務做出貢獻。
外星智慧生命搜尋衛星

Text: Our very own SETI Satellite has been delivered and launched into Martian orbit.
Translation: 我們自己的外星智慧生命搜尋衛星已經發射進了火星軌道。

Text: Our partners on Earth are delighted by the fulfillment of the contract and have expressed their gratitude in a hefty amount of Funding.
Translation: 我們在地球上的合夥人對合約的成果表示滿意，並給了我們大量資金以示感謝。

Text: The remote scientific outpost is set and has started transmitting intriguing data from the Red Planet.
Translation: 遙控科學前哨站已建立完畢並開始從紅色星球向外傳輸十分有趣的資料。

Text: Free Update (Piazzi) - Amphitheater - a new building to comfort your colonists and increase tourists' satisfaction. - UI Improvements - you can see dust ranges during construction, reorder the research queue, see icons above cable and pipe leaks, cycle between grids with the top UI, and find more information per resource in the top UI. - More Colony Control - rename your colony, easily limit births when domes are full, and a new filter option to always include colonists with a specific trait or specialization. Below and Beyond - Underground - a new area to explore right beneath your colony. Uncovering what the Martian Underground hid from us, and expand into the Underground for its resources and shelter from hazards. Just be careful of cave-ins. - Asteroids - a new environment to visit while they travel past Mars. Visit them with an Asteroid Lander to set up a temporary mining outpost. Gather as much as you can before the asteroid moves out of range again. - Exotic Minerals - a new resource obtained from Asteroids, required for several of the new buildings. - Recon & Expansion Research - new field that unlocks new buildings and upgrades for the underground and asteroids. - Uncover new wonders - buried deep below the Martian surface.
Translation: 免費更新（Piazzi） - 露天劇場 - 一種新的建築，用來給你的殖民地居民提供娛樂，提升遊客的舒適度。 - 用戶介面改進 - 你可以在建造期間看到塵土範圍、重新安排研究隊列、查看電纜和洩漏管道上方的圖示、使用頂部介面在供應網之間循環切換、並在頂部介面中看到每種資源的詳情。 - 更多殖民地操作 - 重命名你的殖民地、在穹頂人口滿時輕易地限制生育、新篩選選項：始終包含擁有特定特性或專長的殖民地居民。 上天入地 - 地下 - 在你的殖民地下方有一處新的區域等待探索。發現藏在火星地下的秘密，擴張到地下以獲取資源並躲避災害。就是要當心坍方。 - 小行星 - 小行星是一種全新環境，在它們經過火星時即可前往。用小行星登陸艙前往並建造臨時採礦前哨站。在小行星飛遠之前收集盡可能多的資源。 - 奇異礦物 - 從小行星上開採到的一種新資源，用來建造若干種新建築。 - 偵察和擴張研究 - 此新領域解鎖與地下和小行星相關的新建築與升級。 - 發現新奇觀 - 埋藏在火星地下深處。
Old Text: Free Update (Picard) - Amphitheater - a new building to comfort your colonists and increase tourists' satisfaction. - UI Improvements - you can see dust ranges during construction, reorder the research queue, see icons above cable and pipe leaks, cycle between grids with the top UI, and find more information per resource in the top UI. - More Colony Control - rename your colony, easily limit births when domes are full, and a new filter option to always include colonists with a specific trait or specialization. Below and Beyond - Underground - a new area to explore right beneath your colony. Uncovering what the Martian Underground hid from us, and expand into the Underground for its resources and shelter from hazards. Text: Surviving Mars has been recently updated. You can check the full patch notes online, but here are few highlights:
Translation: 《火星求生》近期已得到更新。您可以在網上查看完整的更新說明，但以下是部分最激動人心的新特色：

Text: Not enough space to create savegame <savename>!
Translation: 空間不足，無法建立存檔<savename>！

Text: Are you sure you want to exit the game?
There is not enough storage space. Delete old save data or disable Autosave from the Options menu.
Translation: 儲存空間不足。刪除舊儲存資料或前往選項選單並停用自動儲存。

Text: The save data limit for this game was reached. Delete old save data or disable Autosave from the Options menu.
Translation: 本遊戲的存檔數量已達上限。刪除舊儲存資料或前往選項選單並停用自動儲存。
自動儲存失敗。<newline>錯誤代碼：<error_code>

Text: Everyone at Mission Control is impatient to see the rocket touching down and unloading its precious cargo - our remotely controlled eyes and hands on the Red Planet - the drones and rovers. Our goal is to secure a foothold for humanity by building the first Martian Dome. This daunting endeavor will allow the brave pioneers - the Founders - to settle on Mars and prove that the colony is sustainable. But until then we have to make sure the colony has enough construction resources, Water, Oxygen and Power. Mission Sponsor: Commander Profile:
Translation: 任務指揮中心的大家都焦急地等待著火箭著陸並卸下上面寶貴的貨物。這些貨物就是無人機與探測車，我們能遙控它們在這顆紅色星球上進行探索與工作。我們的目標是建造第一座火星穹頂，為人類提供立足點。這項艱鉅的工作能讓勇敢的先行者，即創始者們在火星上定居，並證明殖民地能可持續發展。但在目標實現之前，我們得確保殖民地擁有足夠的建築資源、水資源、氧氣和電力。 任務贊助者： 指揮官履歷：

Text: Read the Terms of Use (opens a web browser)
Translation: 閱讀《使用條款》（啟動網頁瀏覽器）

Text: Read the Privacy Policy (opens a web browser)
Translation: 閱讀《隱私政策》（啟動網頁瀏覽器）

Text: I agree to the Terms of Use and the Privacy Policy
Translation: 我同意《使用條款》與《隱私政策》

Text: I do not agree to the Terms of Use and the Privacy Policy
Translation: 我不同意《使用條款》與《隱私政策》

Text:
Welcome to Surviving Mars!

Before you get started, please take a moment to read our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.
Translation:
歡迎來到《火星求生》！

開始遊戲之前，請花一點時間閱讀我們的《使用條款》和《隱私政策》。

Text:
While the Applicants who came to Mars were aware of the many risks that would await them, the near-criminal neglect from our side is something different. We cannot keep this information from the public – and opinions are swaying in the direction that our Colony is a “death trap”.

This troublesome rumor deters many valuable candidates from coming to the new frontier – and these are people we desperately need to fulfill the great mission of colonizing Mars and bringing our vision of the future closer.

<hint> Each time a Colonist dies from a non-natural death, <ApplicantsLostOnColonistDeath> Applicants leave the pool.
Translation:
儘管來火星的應徵者很清楚在火星上要面對各式各樣的危險，但他們沒想到還要面對我們近乎犯罪的人為疏忽。我們不能隱瞞真相，結果大眾開始普遍認為我們的殖民地是個“死亡陷阱”。

這些令人困擾的謠言讓許多本想探索新疆界的寶貴候選人望而卻步，而這些人正是我們完成殖民火星並逐步創造理想中未來所需的人才。

<hint>每當一個殖民者非自然死亡，<ApplicantsLostOnColonistDeath>名應徵者就會離開等候前往火星的隊伍。

Text: The recent Colonist deaths are a worrisome trend which cannot be ignored!
Translation: 最近發生了多起殖民地居民死亡事件，導致人心惶惶，對此我們不能視而不見！

Text:
The dwindling resources on our planet, overpopulation and environmental crisis, as well as the risk of a global-scale Armageddon create a powerful argument for anyone doubting the importance of our mission.

It is a well understood fact that it’s a matter of “when” not “if” for a major extinction event to happen. Having a self-sustaining population on a world other than Earth when the time comes should drastically increase humankind’s odds of survival.

<goal><objective>
Translation:
我們星球上資源的銳減、人口的爆炸、環境的危機以及可能爆發的全球戰爭有力地反駁了一切對我們任務重要性持懷疑態度的人。

一個事實已眾所周知：人類滅絕是必然的，只是時間早晚問題。到那時，在地球之外的星球上擁有自給自足的殖民地應該能大幅提高人類存續的機率。

<goal><objective>

Text: Scientists and visionaries have promoted the idea of “Humanity as a multi-planetary species” as the only way to prevent a possible mass extinction.
Translation: 科學家和有遠見的人早已推廣“人類是個跨行星種族”這一理念，並將其作為防止人類滅絕的唯一方式。

Text:
But this failure shouldn't throw us into despair. We still have to strive to create a stable, self-sustaining foothold from which humanity would reach the stars and conquer them.

<effect>Mission Evaluation objective failed - you have <count> Colonists out of <target> present on the planet. Final Score: <Score>.
Translation:
但我們不能因為這次失敗而心灰意冷。我們仍需努力創造出一個自給自足的穩固立足點，而人類將以這裡為起點，開始茫茫星海的征服之旅。

<effect>任務評價目標失敗。你在星球上擁有<count>個殖民地居民，目標為<target>個。最終得分：<Score>。

Text: We have to admit that we failed to accomplish one of the main goals set before our mission. Sadly, we underestimated the difficulties of sustaining a large population on the Red Planet.
Translation: 我們不得不承認我們沒能完成任務中的一項主要目標。很遺憾，我們低估了在這顆紅色星球上供養大量人口的難度。

Text:
Even that we didn't surpass the expectations, the stable trends of development of the colony are encouraging.

Our achievement is still a tremendous success – we did something which no one imagined to be possible. The Colony would now be a symbol of hope and new beginning, a proof that humanity would persevere and live on regardless of the challenges we face.

<effect> Mission Evaluation objective completed - you have <count> Colonists out of <target> present on the planet. Final Score: <Score>.
Translation:
儘管我們沒能超額完成任務，但殖民地穩定的發展趨勢也十分鼓舞人心。

我們依然取得了巨大的成就，完成了人們眼中不可能完成的任務。殖民地現在將成為希望與全新開始的象徵。它的存在即證明了人類無論面對什麼挑戰都能存續下去。

<effect>任務評價目標完成。你在星球上擁有<count>個殖民地居民，目標為<target>個。最終得分：<Score>。

Text: As the Evaluation Day dawns upon us we can clearly say that the mission to Mars was a success.
Translation: 評價的日子來臨了。我們可以昂首挺胸地說此次火星任務取得了圓滿成功。

Text:
We managed not only to achieve our goals, but also to surpass all expectations as the size of our current Colony is far beyond the initial estimations. This day will be marked in human history by the importance of our accomplishment – we secured the future of humankind as interplanetary species. The Colony would now be a symbol of hope and new beginning, a proof that humanity would persevere and live on regardless of the challenges we face.

<effect> Mission Evaluation objective completed - you have <count> Colonists out of <target> present on the planet. Final Score: <Score>.
Translation:
我們不僅設法達成了目標，還超額完成了任務，目前殖民地的規模遠超預期。我們今天取得的重大成就將被載入史冊：我們為人類開創了跨行星殖民的未來。殖民地現在將成為希望與全新開始的象徵。它的存在即證明了人類無論面對什麼挑戰都能存續下去。

<effect>任務評價目標完成。你在星球上擁有<count>個殖民地居民，目標為<target>個。最終得分：<Score>。

Text: Congratulations! Everyone at Mission Control rejoices as the Colony has been marked as “extremely successful” in the Evaluation Report.
Translation: 恭喜！任務指揮中心的大家歡呼雀躍，因為評價報告中給此次殖民任務的評價為“空前成功”。

Text:
New horizons open new possibilities. Mars can be viewed as a blank canvas – a hostile, uncultivated place where humanity can start anew. A fresh start needs new people – people born on Mars, raised in a society where people cooperate and fight the odds instead of each other.

<goal><objective>
Translation:
新天地蘊含著新的可能性。可將火星視為一塊空白畫布。人類可以在這個環境惡劣的不毛之地創造自己的新世界。全新的開始需要全新的居民。這些居民在火星出生成長，在他們生活的社會裡，人們為了與大自然抗爭而攜手合作，而互相爭鬥。

<goal><objective>

Text: Our civilization, in all its glory, still bears the mark of obsolete cultural and ideological beliefs, from times when people didn't know any better. If we remain ignorant of our own flaws we risk destroying the future for our children.
Translation: 我們光輝燦爛的文明在文化和思想上依然存在著過時的理念，這些理念形成於人類懵懂無知的時代。如果我們繼續對自身的缺陷渾然不知，就有可能毀掉我們子孫的未來。

Text:
Martian birthrate trends are still susceptible to malicious undercurrents and the Colony depends largely on the arrival of Applicants from Earth.

The Sponsors are disappointed that their program goal - a new human civilization on Mars - can't be achieved yet. Probably it was too early to expect that humanity can beat the odds of survival on such a hostile world and reach the level of everyday comfort required to start thinking about children and the future. The burden to disprove the evil tongues who would say this is impossible now lies on our shoulders. There's still work to be done

<effect>Mission Evaluation objective failed - you have <count> Martianborn Colonists out of <target> present in the Colony. Final Score: <Score>.
Translation:
火星人口的出生率仍易受各種危險隱患的影響，殖民地很大程度上依賴從地球來的應徵者。

贊助者們感到失望，因為他們在火星上創造新人類文明的計劃目標尚無法達成。雖然我們指望人類能在這個環境惡劣的星球上克服重重難關過上舒適生活，然後為未來和子孫後代做打算，但現在或許為時過早。居心不良者不停鼓吹我們的任務不可能完成，我們現在揹負著用實際行動證明自己的重擔。我們任重而道遠。

<effect>任務評價目標失敗。你在星球上擁有<count>個火星出生的殖民地居民，目標為<target>個。最終得分：<Score>。

Text: The Mission Evaluation period is over and the progress we've made was marked as... sub-optimal, to say the least.

Text:
If we keep up the good work, in several generations the concept of the Martian civilization would exit the state of the hypothetical and become a reality.

<effect> Mission Evaluation objective completed - you have <count> Colonists present on the planet out of the target <target>. Final Score: <Score>.

如果我們再接再厲，繁衍生息幾代人之後，火星文明這一概念將從假設變為現實。

<effect>任務評價目標完成。你在星球上擁有<count>個殖民地居民，目標為<target>個。最終得分：<Score>。

Text: The Mission Evaluation period is over and the results we have achieved are quite satisfactory.
Translation: 目標評價階段已經結束，我們所取得的成果令人滿意。

Text:
The number of Colonists born on Mars have reached beyond the wildest expectations! This solid base would serve us to promote new values of the new society, to allow the culture of the Red Planet to flourish and develop independent of the bad influence of Earth.

The path ahead of us is rough and uncertain, but who knows, maybe one day the people on Earth would admire the achievements of the Martians in awe, learning from them.

<effect> Mission Evaluation objective completed - you have <count> Martianborn Colonists present on the planet out of the target <target>. Final Score: <Score>.
Translation:
火星上出生的殖民地居民數量遠超預期！這一堅實的人口基礎能幫助我們推廣新社會的新價值觀，使這顆紅色星球上的文化在不受地球惡劣影響的情況下蓬勃發展。

我們的前路崎嶇難料，但誰知道呢，或許有一天，地球上的居民會用敬畏而羨慕的眼光仰望火星居民的成就，並視其為榜樣。

<effect>任務評價目標完成。你在星球上擁有<count>個火星出生的殖民地居民，目標為<target>個。最終得分：<Score>。

Text: The Mission Evaluation period is over and it’s not wrong to say that we managed to outdo ourselves.
Translation: 任務評價階段已經結束，我們無疑超額完成了目標。

Text:
A new era of scientific discovery is ahead of us and we are the ones who are blessed with the opportunity to be on Mars – a completely new territory where new scientific discoveries lie behind the corner. We’re talking about new ideas which would sweep the human minds and the market and give us a tremendous head start in the future.

The primary reason behind the creation of this Colony is scientific and this is what we’re expected to do – to push the boundaries of human knowledge!

<goal><objective>
Translation:
我們面前的是科學發現的新紀元，而我們是得到前往火星機會的幸運兒。這裡是一片嶄新的天地，新科學發現隨處可見。我們所說的新理念將顛覆人類和市場的認知，並使我們贏在未來的起跑線上。

建立這個殖民地的主要原因是科學研究，而開拓人類的知識邊界正是我們的打算！

<goal><objective>

Text: Humankind might be on the verge of a new Golden Age! And we have to be the ones who ride the crest of that wave!
Translation: 人類或許即將迎來全新的黃金時代！而我們就是這一時代的締造者！

Text:
The harsh conditions of Mars proved too overwhelming and the technological leap desired is very far off.

<effect>Mission Evaluation objective failed - you have <count> researched Technologies out of <target>. Final Score: <Score>.
Translation:
火星的條件過於惡劣，我們心中追求的技術大飛躍變成了遙不可及的夢想。

<effect>任務評價目標失敗。你研究了<count>項技術，目標為<target>項。最終得分：<Score>。

Text: At the end of the Mission Evaluation period we have to admit that the pursuit of technological progress on a hostile alien world is an unaccessible luxury, when we're preoccupied with short-term survival.
Translation: 任務評價階段接近尾聲，我們不得不承認在一個環境惡劣的外星球追求科技發展只是一種奢望，因為我們必須為了短期生存而疲於奔命。

Text:
The colony has proven its worth as a cradle of scientific thought and everyone is sure that the future is hiding more secrets to be uncovered and more mysteries solved.

<effect> Mission Evaluation objective completed - you have <count> researched Technologies out of the target <target>. Final Score: <Score>.
Translation:
殖民地用實際行動證明了它是科學思想的寶貴搖籃，大家確信未來還有更多祕密等著我們發現，更多未解之謎等著我們解決。

<effect>任務評價目標完成。你研究了<count>項技術，目標為<target>項。最終得分：<Score>。

Text: The Mission Evaluation period is over and the results of our efforts are visible – a steady track of technological milestones can be traced back to the moment the very first rocket landed on the Red Planet.
Translation: 任務評價階段已經結束，我們的努力成果顯而易見。從第一枚火箭降落到這顆紅色星球時起，我們就開始不斷樹立科技里程碑。

Text:
What’s more important is that we demonstrated to the world that the future is really just behind the corner. Our brightest minds have become icons of prosperity and progress, paving the way for future generations to create a better tomorrow – on Mars, on Earth or any other place in the Universe!

<effect> Mission Evaluation objective completed - you have <count> researched Technologies out of the target <target>! Final Score: <Score>.
Translation:
更重要的是，我們向世人證明了未來真的近在咫尺。我們中才學最高者成了繁榮與進步的代言人，他們為子孫後代鋪平了道路，使他們能在火星、地球或宇宙中任何一個角落創造更美好的未來！

<effect>任務評價目標完成。你研究了<count>項技術，目標為<target>項！最終得分：<Score>。

Text: Our contribution towards the scientific advancement of humankind will be forever remembered. The Evaluation Day report shows accomplishments beyond even our wildest expectations.
Translation: 人們將永遠銘記我們為人類科學進步作出的貢獻。評價日報告顯示我們取得了做夢都想不到的巨大成就。

Text:
Our nature is one of discovery and novelty – our curiosity will never be satisfied. To this we owe much of our civilization’s prosperity and progress.

Exploring the mysteries beyond our world caters to the best in us and by capturing our collective imagination as a species, we bring the focus back to what we can accomplish together instead of bickering and fighting amongst each other.

<goal><objective>
Translation:
我們的大自然裡有無數新鮮的事物等著我們去發現，我們的好奇心永遠不會滿足。我們在很大程度上必須感謝文明的繁榮與進步。

探索其他星球的奧祕是我們的心之所向。我們的成就引起了全人類的興趣，並以此將人們的注意力從你爭我奪、勾心鬥角轉移到了通力合作、共創輝煌上。

<goal><objective>

Text: We are all descendants of those who dared to look beyond the nice, cozy valley they inhabited and enter a world full of mystery and wonder.
Translation: 我們的祖輩敢於放眼自己的安樂窩之外，並來到一個充滿奧祕的神奇新世界。

Text:
The planet turned out to be even more hostile and uninviting than we thought, thwarting any attempts to make a breakthrough in its exploration.

It seems that Mars will continue to be an uncharted territory for the next generations to explore. What matters now is to turn our failure into success by making sure that the Colony is a good starting point for these crews and expeditions that would set off into the red deserts to satisfy their wanderlust.

<effect>Mission Evaluation objective failed – you have analyzed <count> Anomalies out of the target <target>. Final score: <Score>.
Translation:
這顆星球環境的惡劣程度超乎我們預期，導致我們在探索方面舉步維艱。

看來火星這片未知領域只能交給我們的下一代探索了。失敗乃成功之母，現在重要的是我們要將殖民地建設成未來探險隊穩固的大後方，令他們能放心地踏上深入紅色荒漠的旅途，滿足自己對探索的渴望。

<effect>任務評價目標失敗。你分析了<count>處異象，目標為<target>處。最終得分：<Score>。

Text: The Mission Evaluation report confirms what we knew – the target goals were far off from the very beginning.
Translation: 任務評價報告驗證了我們一直以來的想法。目標從一開始就遙不可及。

Text:
We found unexpected treasures buried in the sand of Mars and they only fueled our growing interest to find out more.

What’s more important is that the wave of inspiration has swept over Earth, sparking immense interest and the desire to work together towards a common goal.

<effect>Mission Evaluation objective completed – you have analyzed <count> Anomalies out of the target <target>. Final score: <Score>.
Translation:
我們在火星的紅沙中挖出了意想不到的寶藏，而這些寶藏讓我們繼續探索的慾望更加強烈。

更重要的是，這一振奮人心的大潮席捲了整個地球，無數人對為了共同的目標而攜手合作抱有濃厚的興趣與強烈的渴望。

<effect>任務評價目標完成。你分析了<count>處異象，目標為<target>處。最終得分：<Score>。

Text: The final Mission Evaluation report concludes that the Colony has scored a significant progress in the exploration of the Red Planet.
Translation: 最終任務評價報告總結指出殖民地在探索這顆紅色星球方面取得了可喜的成績。

Text: All resupply missions are temporarily suspended.
Translation: 一切補給任務已暫時中止。

Text: Rockets cannot land or launch during Dust Storms. We will have to wait until the storm is over.
Translation: 沙塵暴期間火箭無法著陸或發射。必須等到風暴結束。

Text: This Rocket is not yet refueled for the next voyage.<newline><newline>Fuel is produced in a Fuel Refinery building supplied with Water. It is then transported by Drones to the Rocket.
Translation: 這枚火箭的燃料尚不足以返回地球。<newline><newline>燃料精煉廠可以用水生產燃料。之後無人機會將燃料運送至火箭上。
Old Text: This Rocket is not yet refueled for the return trip to Earth.<newline><newline>Fuel is produced in a Fuel Refinery building supplied with Water. It is then transported by Drones to the Rocket.

Text: The Rocket is not currently landed. It will have to land and refuel for re-launch.
Translation: 火箭目前尚未著陸。火箭必須先著陸並補充燃料後才能再次發射。

Text: Not all resources from this Rocket have been unloaded yet. If the Rocket launches now, the remaining resources on board will be lost.<newline><newline>To complete the unloading process, make sure there is enough available storage space in the vicinity as well as operational Drones to transport the resources.
Translation: 火箭上仍有未卸下的資源。如果現在發射，你將失去火箭上的資源。<newline><newline>完成資源解除安裝的方法：確保附近有足夠的儲存空間，且有足夠的無人機運送資源。

Text: Launch Issue: Remaining Resources on Board
Translation: 發射問題：火箭上仍有資源

Text: There are passengers on board but there's only space for new residents in the Colony.
Translation: 火箭上有名乘客，但殖民地只能容納名新居民。
Old Text: There are passengers on board the Rocket but there's only space for new residents in the Colony.
Old Translation: 火箭上有名乘客，但殖民地只能容納名新居民。

Text: The Rocket has malfunctioned and needs repairs.
Translation: 火箭出現故障，需要維修。

Text: You can't launch this rocket currently.
Translation: 目前你無法發射此火箭。

Text: No applicants match the selected filters
Translation: 無應徵者符合選中的篩選條件

Text:
Whatever lies within the Sphere is pretty capable of harnessing any energy projected at it. Furthermore, the energy used by our instruments seems to have furthered its power-up process.

<effect>The Sphere charges a bit
Translation:
我們不知道球體裡存在著什麼物質，但它能利用我們向其發射的一切能量。此外，我們所用的儀器的能量似乎推進了它的充能進度。

<effect>球體略微發生了變化。

Text: Our attempts to penetrate the outer layer of the Sphere were unsuccessful, though they did yield some interesting results.
Translation: 我們想盡辦法也沒能穿透球體的外層，但期間產生了一些有意思的結果。

Text: I kinda hope it stays quiet
Translation: 我希望它一直這麼沉默下去。

Text:
So thorough is the absorption process that we fail to detect even the slightest reflected wave being thrown back at us. Aside from that the Sphere remains, unsurprisingly, quiet.

<effect>The Sphere charges a bit
Translation:
吸收過程非常徹底，我們甚至偵測不到一絲被反射回來的電波。除此之外，這個球體依然無聲無息地靜置在這裡，我們也已習慣了這種沉默。

<effect>球體略微發生了變化。

Text: Our test results tell us the Sphere accumulates energy by absorbing radio waves,
Translation: 我們的測試結果顯示這個球體透過吸收無線電波來累積能量。

Text:
While energy direction by itself is not something so unusual, utilizing it for a purpose implies intent or at least programming of some kind. Our current test-grade proof will most certainly help encourage our scientists currently tackling this mystery.
 
<effect>The Sphere charges a bit
Translation:
雖然引導能量本身並不罕見，但為了特定的目的而引導能量說明這是它有意為之，或至少表明它被進行過某種程式設計。我們目前取得的證據無疑會激勵正在著手研究這一奧祕的科學家們。

<effect>球體略微發生了變化

Text: Our running hypothesis seems to be correct. It’s releasing energy to charge faster. Maybe it’s alive?
Translation: 我們目前的假設似乎是正確的。它正在釋放能量以加快充能速度。它難道是活物嗎？

Text: Keep me up to speed on any finds.
Translation: 有任何發現都要第一時間通知我。

Text:
Its surface is perfectly smooth and also seems to sport mirror-like features.

The way this sphere reflects its surroundings has struck our team as being especially odd. It reflects not what one would expect, and in some instances seems to entirely ignore the observer from the reflection.   

This has the potential to be something monumental. Further excavation is most definitely encouraged by everyone here at Mission Control.

<effect> A half-buried sphere is revealed
Translation:
球體表面光滑圓潤，似乎還有鏡子的特徵。

我們的團隊認為球體反射周圍景物的方式十分不尋常。它反射的方式異於常理，有時候在反射中似乎完全看不到觀察者。 

也許我們挖到了什麼不得了的東西。可以肯定的是，任務指揮中心裡的所有人都鼓勵我們繼續挖掘。

<effect>發現了一個半埋在地裡的球體。

Text: A short dig following an off-the-charts reading revealed a metallic spheroid buried just beneath the surface.
Translation: 我們偵測到一次超標讀數後進行了短暫的挖掘，從地表下挖出了一個金屬球體。

Text: That’s some B-movie material right there.
Translation: 這就是B級片裡常見的老梗嘛。

Text:
Our most sensitive instruments detect a very weak, yet constant low frequency vibration, giving the Sphere a sort of hum. At least no harmful particles are detected. 

We will be waiting for further test results.

<effect>The Sphere begins charging.
Translation:
我們最敏感的儀器偵測到了一個非常微弱但持續不斷的低頻震動，使這個球體嗡嗡作響。至少我們沒有偵測到有害粒子。

我們會等待進一步的測試結果。

<effect>球體正在充能。

Text: We tried interacting with it, which triggered some sort of response. The Sphere isn’t dormant anymore.
Translation: 我們嘗試與其進行互動，結果觸發了某種回應。球體從休眠中甦醒。

Text: The Sphere should be watched closely at all times!

Mission Control was struck speechless as the half excavated Sphere finished the job itself and un-burrowed fully on its own, then began moving - levitating with the aid of some propulsion method unknown to us. 

Around it, temperatures fell drastically, creating a cold area that moved around with it. Mission Control is scrambling to predict where it’s headed to and if this cold zone is a byproduct of its propulsion method. Or more like its function. 

These are exciting times – scary, but exciting.

<effect>The Sphere begins moving.
Translation:
這個半埋的球體替我們省去了挖掘的工作，自己破土而出，然後開始移動，利用某種我們不知道的推進手段逐漸升空。任務指揮中心的眾人看得目瞪口呆。

它周圍的溫度驟降，形成隨自身移動的低溫區域。任務指揮中心正手忙腳亂地預測它會飛往何處，並猜測這個低溫區域到底是祂推進手段的副產品，還是運作原理。

這一刻雖然可怕，但依然激動人心。

<effect>球體開始移動。

Text: Definitive contact with an extraterrestrial being, for the first time in the history of mankind.
Translation: 這絕對是人類歷史上與外星生物的首次接觸。

Text:
While we aren’t sure if the Sphere has any set destination it is hovering towards, we have enough evidence to say that a new process has been initiated by the Sphere. For what purpose, we cannot say as of now.

<hint> The Sphere drains batteries and charges quicker.
Translation:
雖然我們不知道這個漂浮的球體是否有明確的目的地，但我們有足夠的證據表明球體已經開始了新的進展。目前我們還不知道它有什麼目的。

<hint>球體吸收電池的電力，充能速度加快。

Text: Spheres: The Sphere is a Sucker!
Translation: 球體：這個球體會吸收電能！

Text: It seems to be absorbing any sort of electrical current in close proximity. In other words, it’s feeding on our batteries.
Translation: 它似乎能吸收自身附近的一切電流。換句話說，我們的電池在給它提供能量。

Text: The safety of our citizens is always a priority!
Translation: 居民的安全永遠是第一位的！

Text: While it does not seem to be lethal in any moderate doses, any Colonist, subject to the Sphere’s influence, shows signs of deteriorating health and needs a solid few days at the Infirmary. Our researchers have several theories on what this phenomenon is and should we prioritize it, we may be able to come up with a way to protect our citizens from the harmful influence of any such Sphere. Sphere Protection research available.
Translation: 雖然只要不在球體附近逗留太久就不會有生命危險，但受球體影響的殖民地居民出現了健康狀況惡化的症狀，需要在醫務室靜養好幾天才能恢復。 對於這一現象，我們的研究者提出了若干種理論。如果我們優先研究這一現象，或許就能想出辦法幫助居民抵禦這類球體的有害影響。 球體防護研究已開放。

Text: The humming’s less than subtle now, with the added bonus that it’s clearly harming any Colonists that come too close.
Translation: 球體的嗡鳴聲越來越響，以至於對過於接近的殖民地居民造成傷害。
呃，這恐怕不是什麼好事……

Text:
In a moment of pure awesomeness the Sphere split into two identical Spheres. The new objects have grown to the exact same size as the previous one.

The second Sphere is now entirely independent from the first, moving in a direction of its own choosing, yet the two Spheres are clearly interacting with each other at a distance. Their humming frequencies are changing simultaneously and the more they resonate, the more a slight ionization of the atmosphere around them becomes evident.

At the moment of the splitting a vast amount of data was gathered by our instruments, so we may have the means to dig deeper within this mystery. Until then we can only predict that some event will trigger when a certain resonance frequency has been reached by both Spheres.

<effect>The Sphere divided into two separate Spheres.
Translation:
球體在一瞬間匪夷所思地分裂成了兩個一模一樣的球體。新出現球體的體積已變得和之前的球體完全相同。

第二個球體現在完全獨立於第一個，按照自己選擇的方向移動，而兩個球體顯然在進行著遠距離互動。嗡鳴的頻率同時發生變化，它們共鳴得越多，球體周圍大氣的離子化就越明顯。

球體分裂的瞬間，我們的儀器接收到了大量資料，因此我們或許有辦法深入探索這一奧祕。在揭開奧祕之前，我們只能推測當兩個球體的共鳴達到一個特定頻率時，就會觸發某種事件。

<effect>球體分裂為了兩個單獨的球體。

Text: The Mirror Sphere has Mission Control in total chaos. Though that’s expected given what we saw.
Translation: 鏡面球體令任務指揮中心陷入一片混亂。但這也在我們的意料之中，畢竟看到了不得了的景象。

Text:
Apart from controlling where it goes and what damage it does, this is of little use to us at the moment as we can’t dismantle them or even hinder their function in any way. 

However, this is critical for closer observation and research.

<effect> A Sphere is being held motionless.
Translation:
我們目前只能控制它的移動方向以及造成的傷害，但這幾乎沒什麼用，因為我們無法將其拆開或以任何方式妨礙其正常運轉。

但話說回來，這對我們對其進行進一步觀察研究至關重要。

<effect>球體禁止不動。

Text: Those decoy buildings worked just like we planned, much to the dismay of our hardworking engineers. We've captured our first Sphere!
Translation: 雖然我們辛勤工作的工程師開心不起來，但那些誘餌建築物發揮了預期的作用。我們捕獲了第一個球體！

Text:
The Sphere is converted back to its precious ingredients.

Our scientists are quick to inform us that any Sphere free from our decoy buildings will roll back to its splitting phase and will most probably try to retrieve the critical amount needed for their collective purpose.

We feel we have gathered enough information from these Spheres. It’s been deemed that decomposing all the Spheres is our best road of action.

<effect> A Sphere was converted into resources.
Translation:
球體被轉變為了構成自身的寶貴原料。

科學家們很快就通知我們不受誘餌建築物控制的球體將回到分離階段，且很有可能設法獲取分裂所必需的資源。

我們認為已經從這些球體中搜集到了足夠的資訊。現在分解所有球體是最明智的做法。

<effect>一個球體轉變為了資源。

Text: Humanity applied its knowledge of an alien technology for the first time ever. And it was a complete success.
Translation: 人類首次運用了對外星技術的知識，並取得了圓滿成功。

Text: This is now officially a fight for survival.
Translation: 生存之戰現在正式開始。

Text: What or who needs to lower the atmospheric temperature of contemporary Mars is beyond any of us – yet it is most evident that the Spheres are effective at what they are doing. If we want to stop the change, we must find a breakthrough based on what we already know and learn how to control or cancel this process. A prolonged, extremely strong Cold Wave has begun. Xeno-Terraforming research available.
Translation: 我們中沒人能想明白究竟是什麼人或什麼東西需要降低目前火星的氣溫。然而這些球體顯然能十分有效地改變氣候。 如果我們想要阻止氣候變化，就得想辦法根據已知的知識做出突破並學會如何控制或停止這一過程。 曠日持久的極強寒流來襲。 異星地形改造研究已可用。

Text:
The Cold Wave that had gripped our Colony has finally been dispelled. Temperatures have returned to the normal, cruelly cold levels we are used to.

Our scientists are confident that we have recorded and gathered all data necessary for making sense of this encounter in the coming decades. Also, they are confident that the Spheres themselves had overstayed their welcome. 

Keeping them around would have meant living with the ever-present danger of re-activating the endless Cold Wave once more, even if we had managed to find a way to halt it without destroying all the Spheres. 

And despite the risks, despite the purely pragmatic reasons for destroying all the Spheres, one can’t help but wonder how the generations to come will feel of this deed. Will we go down in history as cowards? Or maybe as too insensitive to the magnitude of the encounter, the very first non-man-made technology ever found?

When our scientists give up on trying to determine the origin of these Spheres, will textbooks mention that because of the rash actions and fears of the few pioneers that lived on Mars at the time, the riddle will never be solved?

<effect> No more Spheres are left.
<effect> Cold Wave dispelled.
Translation:
席捲我們殖民地的寒流終於散去。溫度已恢復到我們已經習慣的正常水準，不過依然冷得要命。

科學家們確信我們已經記錄並搜集到了所需的一切資料，只要花個幾十年就能解釋這次事件。另外，他們還確信球體本身已經失去了利用價值。

若留著它們，我們就隨時都有重新啟用漫長寒流的風險，就算我們真有辦法在不摧毀所有球體的前提下停止寒流也是如此。

儘管有風險，儘管摧毀所有球體是純粹講究實效的決定，但我們還是會不禁琢磨子孫後代會如何評判這一做法。我們會以懦夫的身份被載入史冊嗎？還是說，對此次事件的重要性一知半解的人會將此次遭遇視為人類首次發現了外星人技術嗎？儘管這種說法將這次事件的重要性大打折扣。

我們的科學家放棄探索這些球體的來源時，教科書裡是否會寫著：由於當時居住在火星上的少數先行者魯莽行事後又害怕承擔後果，於是球體從何而來成為了永遠的謎？

<effect>球體已被全部銷燬。
<effect>寒流消散了。

Text:
As difficult and painful as it is, we must accept that <ColonistName(colonist)> is dead. As friends, as a community, we express our sadness, we acknowledge our loss, acknowledge the great importance of <ColonistName(colonist)>’s life.

<ColonistName(colonist)>’s life has been a journey towards a vision, a journey which brought us all towards the possibility of living on the Red Planet, one small step after at a time. <ColonistName(colonist)> didn’t try to make their mark in human history, for there is no room for attempts in success. <ColonistName(colonist)> knew what the calling of fate was, knew the risks and the opportunities and made the best of it, for the good of us all.

What is it that takes a person through all of this is a question only we can answer. This is a question whose answer is the spirit of <ColonistName(colonist)>, and this is a legacy for us.

<effect><ColonistName(colonist)> has died. Cause: <reason>
<hint> Each time a Colonist dies from a non-natural death, two Applicants leave the pool
Translation:
雖然這令人悲痛萬分，但我們必須接受<ColonistName(colonist)>已亡故的事實。作為友人和社群，我們寄託哀思，並認可<ColonistName(colonist)>生命的重大意義。

<ColonistName(colonist)>的一生是一場向著理想前進的旅程，這次旅程使我們一步步接近在這顆紅色星球上生活的可能性。<ColonistName(colonist)>並不致力於將自己載入人類史冊，因為史冊不會記載為了成功而不斷嘗試者。<ColonistName(colonist)>深知使命感為何物，也知道自己會面臨的危險與機遇，並為了我們大家而拼盡了全力。

是什麼樣的精神能令一個人堅持挺過這一切？只有我們能解答。這個問題的答案就是<ColonistName(colonist)>的精神，而這種精神已經傳承給了我們。

<effect><ColonistName(colonist)>已經死亡。死因：<reason>
<hint>每當一個殖民者非自然死亡，兩名應徵者就會離開等候前往火星的隊伍。

Text: A Eulogy for an Everyday Hero
We gather here today to bid a final farewell to one of our finest.
Translation: 今天，我們聚集於此，向我們最傑出的同胞道別。

Text:
<ColonistName(colonist)>, as every other Colonist, went through psychological conditioning before arriving on Mars to guarantee their most basic ability to cope with the adverse environment. Indeed, the people live on a barren, dead-cold world with a toxic, almost non-existent atmosphere, protected only by a fragile-looking Dome and relying on machines to keep them alive.

The unparalleled everyday stress levels slowly drain the people of their resolve – thus even the slightest shock or frustration can send someone over the edge. On Earth entertainment and recreation are just for fun, but here they are a tool for basic survival.

<hint> The Colonist <ColonistName(colonist)> has reached critically low Sanity. Provide operational Healthcare buildings in the Domes and avoid Heavy workload or Nighttime work to prevent this situation.
Translation:
<ColonistName(colonist)>和其他人一樣，在到達火星之前進行過心理適應訓練，以確保其擁有應對惡劣環境的基本能力。人們確實生活在一個荒蕪、死寂、冰冷、大氣稀薄而有毒的星球上，唯一的防護措施就是一個看起來很脆弱的穹頂，且必須靠機器維持生命。

人們每天都生活在無比巨大的壓力之下，這使得他們的決心漸漸動搖，因此即使是最輕微的驚愕或沮喪都能讓另一個人精神崩潰。在地球上，休閒娛樂僅僅是為了獲得樂趣，但在這裡，娛樂是一樣不可或缺的生存工具。

<hint>殖民地居民<ColonistName(colonist)>的理智度已降至臨界值。在穹頂中建造正常運轉的醫療保健建築並避免高負荷或夜間工作即可防止這種情況的發生。
一個殖民地居民剛剛崩潰了！

Text:
Our Domes are large enough to contain tons of breathable air, but when the systems fail to refresh the supply, the amount of carbon dioxide will steadily increase until the atmosphere becomes unbreathable.

<hint> Colonists with the Suffocating status effect have no access to Oxygen and will die within a short time. Connect their Dome to operational MOXIEs and Oxygen Tanks or plant Oxygen-Producing Crops in Farms to supply them with Oxygen.
Translation:
我們巨大的穹頂能容納數噸的可呼吸空氣，但當系統無法補充新鮮空氣時，二氧化碳的濃度就會不斷上升，直至空氣變得無法呼吸。

<hint>無法呼吸到氧氣的殖民地居民會擁有呼吸困難狀態效果，並會在短時間內死亡。將他們的穹頂與正常運轉的氧氣生成裝置和氧氣罐，或在農場裡種植產生氧氣的作物連接即可為他們提供氧氣。

Text: Our Colonists are suffocating! We only have a few hours to get them more Oxygen before they run out!
Translation: 我們殖民地的居民正在窒息！我們只有幾個小時為他們製造氧氣，不然他們都將喪命！

Text:
Water is the vital fluid which sustains all life. The human body requires a constant access to fresh, drinkable water and quickly deteriorates when none is present. Thus the extraction of Water is one of our utmost priorities.

<hint> Colonists with the Dehydrated status effect have no access to Water and will die within a short time. Connect their Dome to operational Water Producers or filled Water Towers to supply them with Water.
Translation:
水是一切生命賴以為生的泉源。人體每天都需要潔淨的飲用水。如果沒有水，身體狀況就會迅速惡化。因此開採水資源是我們最重要的任務之一。

<hint>無法使用水資源的殖民地居民會擁有脫水狀態效果，並會在短時間內死亡。將他們的穹頂與正常運轉的造水設施或裝滿的水塔相連即可為他們提供水資源。

Text: The Colonists are on the brink of dehydration! We need to figure out something quick before they die.
Translation: 殖民地居民即將脫水！我們得趕快想辦法，不然他們就要渴死了。

Text:
Domes feature heaters which maintain a pleasant temperature of 23 degrees Celsius around the clock, protecting against the fluctuating temperature of the fickle Martian atmosphere outside. The temperature inside the Dome quickly decreases when the power supply is cut and the Colonists sure do feel the effects. If the situation remains unchanged, I'm afraid that it could be fatal.

<hint> Colonists with the Freezing status effect reside in a Dome with an insufficient supply of Power. Increase the amount of Power accessible to the Dome to prevent this.
Translation:
穹頂內常年維持著攝氏23度的宜人氣溫。外界變化無常的火星大氣會令溫度產生劇烈波動，但穹頂內不會受到影響。當斷電時，穹頂內氣溫會迅速下降，殖民地居民必然會感受到溫度變化。如果這種情況一直持續，恐怕會出人命。

<hint>居住在電力不足的穹頂中的居民會擁有受凍狀態效果。提升供應給穹頂的電量可防止此情況發生。

Text: Our Colonists are suffering from hypothermia!
Translation: 我們的殖民地居民體溫過低！

Text:
Constant supply of fresh nutrients is vital to the survival of the Colony. The Colonists can go on for some time before they suffer more adverse effects from the lack of food, but if you don't feed them soon, they will die.

<hint> Colonists with the Starving status effect have no access to Food. Deliver Food from Earth or produce it by farming to supply the starving.
Translation:
持續供應新鮮營養物質對殖民地的生存至關重要。缺少食物的殖民地居民能繼續存活一段時間，但不久後就會承受更多負面效果。如果你不儘快給他們提供食物，他們就會死亡。

<hint>吃不到食物的殖民地居民會擁有飢餓狀態效果。從地球運來食物或在農場中生產食物可防止居民挨餓。
我們的殖民地正在鬧饑荒！

Text:
<ColonistName(colonist)> had a dream – to see humanity united, conquering the stars. And <ColonistName(colonist)> allowed nothing to stand in the path of this dream. No hardship, no loss, not even personal safety. What more can anyone be asked to do?

We had known many women and men of character, of strength and virtue. Any one of them might have stepped into <ColonistName(colonist)>'s place and we would be none the wiser. But we know why <ColonistName(colonist)> chose this path. When a heart as big and strong beats in one's chest it gives no other option but to follow its call.

When <ColonistName(colonist)> fell, it left a void. Do not let it take over your hearts, friends. Do not mourn the icon of good that we have lost, rather rise up and become the icon yourself. Let this death be not a blow against the will of humanity to grow, learn and conquer new frontiers.

<hint>The Founder <ColonistName(colonist)> died. Cause: <reason>.
Translation:
<ColonistName(colonist)>曾有一個夢想，夢想著看到人類團結一致，征服星辰大海。為了實現這個夢想，<ColonistName(colonist)>排除萬難。這位偉人不畏懼艱難困苦，不在意個人得失，甚至不顧及自己的人身安全。試問有幾個人能做到這種地步？

很多傑出人物因其人格、堅強和美德而為我們所熟知。換做這些人中的任何一人，都會做出和<ColonistName(colonist)>一樣的選擇，而我們依然是老樣子。但我們知道<ColonistName(colonist)>為何選擇了這條路。當一個人的胸懷足夠寬廣，意志足夠堅強時，這個人除了追隨自己內心的呼喚外別無他法。

<ColonistName(colonist)>的離世在我們的心中產生了空洞。但朋友們，不要讓這個空洞吞噬你們的內心。不要因為失去了一位偉人而哀悼，而是要化悲痛為力量，自己努力成為偉人。不要讓人類發展的意願因這位偉人的死而備受打擊，而是要從中學習教訓並征服新的疆界。

<hint>創始者<ColonistName(colonist)>已經死亡。死因：<reason>

Text: The day claimed our last living Founder, spelling the end of an era for us all.
Translation: 今天我們最後一位創始者過世了，對我們來說，一個時代也結束了。

Text:
We will all have our own special memories of the mark <ColonistName(colonist)> left in our hearts and in our lives. I am certain that <ColonistName(colonist)> would have wanted us all to be here today filled not with grief but with strength, vision and hope for the future. This is what <ColonistName(colonist)> lived for and doing otherwise would make this cause pointless.

We are all here today not only because <ColonistName(colonist)> laid down the foundations of our Colony. We were all personally touched and inspired by their strong character, personality and presence. We were all very lucky to have had <ColonistName(colonist)> beside us in both good and bad moments and, as much as will be missing our comrade, their memory will live on as long as we remain united.

<hint>The Founder <ColonistName(colonist)> passed away due to old age.
Translation:
<ColonistName(colonist)>在我們每個人的心中都留下了特別的記憶。我確信<ColonistName(colonist)>在天有靈並不想看到我們聚集在這裡時懷著悲痛的心情，而應該振作精神，心懷希望，放眼未來。<ColonistName(colonist)>為此奮鬥終生，若非如此，這項事業也會失去意義。

我們今天聚集於此並非因為<ColonistName(colonist)>為我們的殖民地打下了基礎。而是因為此人的堅強的個性、人格和存在深深地觸動了我們所有人。有<ColonistName(colonist)>在我們身邊的日子裡，無論喜怒哀樂，我們都十分幸運能有這位同伴。雖然我們想念這位朋友，只要我們團結在一起，此人就會永遠活在我們心中。

<hint>創始者<ColonistName(colonist)>壽終正寢。

Text: Do Not Go Gentle Into That Good Night
Translation: 不要溫和地走進那個良夜

Text: Today was a tough one. We lost one of our Founders.
Translation: 今天十分令人悲痛。我們失去了一位創始者。

Text: Despite the great lengths we go through to make it seem safe and as close as possible to home, one’s mind is never too far from the dangers that the privilege of being an interplanetary pioneer carries. We all find our own ways to cope with this pressure. finds it in the bottle. The Founder has the Alcoholic Trait.
Translation: 儘管我們竭盡全力為所有人營造儘可能安全又溫馨的家園，但身為星際探索的先行者，我們的心理健康仍時刻受到威脅。我們都有自己應對壓力的方式。的方式是酗酒。 創始者擁有酒鬼特性。

Text: Nobody Knows The Trouble I've Seen...
It's a rough life here on Mars. You can't prepare for addiction.
Translation: 火星上的日子很不好過。犯癮令人防不勝防。

Text: For they are meant to tread and live where no man has ever lived before – in an environment not meant for man to live in to begin with. This is why it came as a shock to us all when turned out to be such a whiner! The Founder has the Whiner Trait.
Translation: 因為他們註定會踏上從未有人去過的地方並在那裡生活，而那種地方本身就不適合人類居住。所以當我們發現原來是個愛發牢騷的傢伙時，大家都嚇呆了！ 創始者擁有愛發牢騷特性。

Text: In Space, No One Can Hear you Whine
Translation: 在太空裡沒人聽得見你發牢騷

Text: The Founders are supposed to be the pillars of the future Colony – destined to be remembered for generations.
Translation: 創始人本應是未來殖民地的支柱，註定會被子孫後代銘記。

Text: They face uncertainty which no humans have faced before. on the other hand, albeit a pioneer, doesn’t seem especially brave and makes jumping in fright after seeing one’s own shadow look like a normal thing. The Founder has the Coward Trait.
Translation: 先行者們要面對沒人面對過的未知情況。儘管是這樣一位先行者，但此人看起來並不怎麼勇敢，被自己的影子嚇一跳對此人來說是很正常的事。 創始者擁有膽小特性。

Text: It takes more than bravery to be a pioneer of the Martian frontier. Or at least it should.
Translation: 成為探索火星的先行者需要的不僅僅是勇氣。不過至少得擁有勇氣。

Text: After all, purpose is the strongest long-term driver. Since arriving on Mars, 's enthusiasm has proven to be above average, even by Founder norms, and the prodigious productivity displayed can be boiled down to one simple explanation – really loves doing what ‘s doing. The Founder has the Enthusiast trait.
Translation: 畢竟，決心是最強大的長遠驅動力。自抵達火星以來，表現出了超乎尋常的熱情，就算以創始者的標準衡量也是如此。此人展現出驚人生產效率的原因可以歸納為一點，就是真心熱愛的工作。 創始人擁有熱心特性。

Text: Building a new home on an alien world? That takes guts, to say the least.
Translation: 在外星球建造新家園至少需要勇氣。

Text: They travel through 50 million miles to a rocky, inhospitable world and try to bend it to humanity's will. , on the other hand, seems to also be a gambler in the more traditional sense. We must not judge. On the contrary, we must be supportive and help our dear comrade with whom we’ve traversed the void, spearheaded humanity’s expansion on other worlds, only to find that we are no safer from vices so Earthly, it’s as if we never left. The Founder has the Gambler trait.
Translation: 他們飛越五千萬英里來到一個不適宜居住的荒涼星球，並意圖用人類的意志征服這片不毛之地。但話說回來，似乎是一個傳統意義上的賭徒。 我們不能對別人妄加評論。但我們必須和親愛的同伴們互相幫助，畢竟我們一起穿越了虛空，一起充當人類探索其他星球的先鋒，可結果卻發現在火星上依然擺脫不了地球上的種種惡習，彷彿我們從未離開地球一樣。 創始者擁有賭徒特性。

Text: The first Colonists are all gamblers coming to Mars. It's the ultimate roll of the dice.
Translation: 第一批來到火星的殖民地居民都是一幫賭徒。這是終極的賭博。

Text: Warning signs and instructions are, usually, enough to prevent most of them being done by most people. is not like most people and instructions and warnings seem to be of little to no use. We, as a small community, have come to accept the obvious: The Founder has the Idiot trait.
Translation: 警告標誌和指示通常足以讓大多數人避免這些失誤。與大多數人不同，指示和警告標誌似乎並不起作用。 我們作為一個小團體，已經接受了一個顯而易見的事實： 創始者擁有愚蠢特性。

Text: Living in cramped quarters, tinkering with intricate machinery day-in, day-out. There's plenty of opportunities for slip-ups.
Translation: 住在狹小的居所，日復一日修補錯綜複雜的機器。操作失誤是難免的。

Text:
The Founders had always been more than explorers and pioneers. They shared a vision of the future of the civilization on the Red Planet and worked ceaselessly towards their common goal.

But, as it often happens during the course of history the, societal standpoint changes. <ColonistName(colonist)> could not adapt to the changing times and decided to leave Mars. I know <ColonistName(colonist)> personally and I'm sure that this isn't caused by disappointment but instead is a rational decision. I remember one time when we talked about the future of the Colony and <ColonistName(colonist)>'s words: “We are the progenitors of the Colony but parents have to eventually step down and give way to their children.”

As I watch the rocket fly towards Earth I cannot force myself to think that <ColonistName(colonist)> is abandoning us. Something tells me that we will be in contact and will continue to receive wise council from our last Founder.

<hint>The last Founder <ColonistName(colonist)> has left Mars.
Translation:
一直以來，創始者都不僅僅是探索者和先行者。他們對這顆紅色星球上文明的未來有相同的願景，並為了達成共同的目標而廢寢忘食地工作。

但社會的立場發生了變化，這在歷史上屢見不鮮。<ColonistName(colonist)>無法適應時代的變化，於是決定離開火星。我和<ColonistName(colonist)>是熟人，我確信此人做此決定並非出於失望而是出於理智。我記得有一次我和<ColonistName(colonist)>談論殖民地的未來時，此人的原話是：“我們是殖民地的創始人，但我們終究要給子孫後代讓步。”

就在我目送飛向地球的火箭之際，我不禁萌生出一個想法：<ColonistName(colonist)>拋棄了我們。我有預感，這位最後的創始者依然會與我們取得聯絡並為我們出謀劃策。

<hint>最後一名創始者<ColonistName(colonist)>離開了火星。

Text: Mars has ways of crushing the hope out of our very best.
Translation: 火星有各種辦法粉碎我們最美好的希望。

Text:
The next 10 Sols will be full of difficulties and dangers, but also with great promises and opportunities. It is now to us to prove that Mars can be a doorway to greater riches and the future of the human civilization. Even the most epic adventures begin with a single step.

<effect> Arrival of additional Colonists temporarily suspended until the Colony proves able to sustain human life. Your Founder Colonists must survive for 10 Sols before additional people can arrive.

<hint> The Colony will be evaluated positively before the period ends in the event the first human is born on Mars. If you feel you are up to the challenge, try constructing a Medical Building and raising the Comfort of the Founders as much as possible with Service Buildings.
Translation:
接下來的10個太陽日裡會危機四伏且困難重重，但也有機遇與成功的可能。現在就要靠我們證明火星可以成為通往巨大財富與人類文明未來的大門了。無論多宏大的冒險，都開始於踏出的第一步。

<effect>在殖民地能維持人類生命之前，不會有更多殖民者到達。你的殖民地的創始者居民必須存活10天，其他人才會到達。

<hint>在時間結束前，如果首個人類在火星上出生，則殖民地會得到正面評價。如果你願意接受挑戰，則嘗試建造一座醫療建築並用服務建築儘可能提高創始者的舒適度。

Text: Full of hope and determination, the first Founders have set foot on the Red Planet.
Translation: 滿懷希望的首批創始者毅然踏上了這顆紅色星球。

Text:
The Colonists have always felt like a family. But what makes the family stronger and more united is the promise of new life and better future. We have truly been blessed with a rewarding responsibility – to carry the torch of hope.

Let this blooming of life serve as a symbol for all humans. Mars is no longer a dead world.

<effect> The Colony has been evaluated positively. Additional Colonists can be called from Earth.
Translation:
殖民地一直以来就像一个大家庭。但若要加强这个家庭的凝聚力，就要让人们看到新生命与美好未来的希望。我们手持着希望的火炬，能肩负这一令人有成就感的职责是上天的恩赐。

就讓這個新生命成為全人類的象徵。火星也能孕育出生命了。

<effect>殖民地得到了正面評價。可以從地球上徵召額外殖民地居民。

Text:
The Colonists have always felt like a family. But what makes the family stronger and more united is the promise of new life and better future. We have truly been blessed with a rewarding responsibility – to carry the torch of hope.

Let this blooming of life serve as a symbol for all humans. Mars is no longer a dead world.

<effect> The Colony has been evaluated positively. You can't call anymore colonists from Earth due to the Last Ark game rule.
Translation:
殖民地一直以來就像一個大家庭。但若要加強這個家庭的凝聚力，就要讓人們看到新生命與美好未來的希望。我們手持著希望的火炬，能肩負這一令人有成就感的職責是上天的恩賜。

就讓這個新生命成為全人類的象徵。火星也能孕育出生命了。

<effect>殖民地得到了正面評價。由於最後的方舟遊戲規則，您無法從地球上運輸更多殖民地居民到火星。

Text: For the first time, a human has been born on Mars. It's truly a unique miracle.
Translation: 第一名新生兒在火星出生了。這是獨一無二的奇蹟。

Text:
The long-time dream of the human civilization as a whole – to settle another world – has come true. To be among the people who made this happen makes me feel enthusiastic and proud.

We are already swarmed with applications for relocation on Mars and the wanderlust and enthusiasm of these people makes me proud to be a human being. The Red Planet continues to be inhospitable and even dangerous but we as a species had always displayed the ability to adapt and improve – the adverse conditions will only make us try harder. So I say bring it on!

<effect> The Colony has been evaluated positively. Additional Colonists can be called from Earth.
Translation:
人類文明多年以來在外星球殖民的夢想終於成真了。我此刻的心情既激動又自豪，因為我也為實現這個夢想出了一份力。

我們已經收到無數人發來的移居火星的申請，這些人的熱情與探索欲令我因自己身為一名人類而深感驕傲。這顆紅色星球依然不適宜居住，甚至危機四伏，但我們這個種族一直以來都擁有適應與進步的能力，逆境只會催使我們迎難而上。世上無難事，只怕有心人！

<effect>殖民地得到了正面評價。可以從地球上徵召額外殖民地居民。

Text: Looks like we’ve got a serious adventure ahead of us!
Translation: 看來我們即將迎來一場大冒險！
Old Text: Looks live we’ve got a serious adventure ahead of us!
Old Translation: 看來我們即將迎來一場大冒險！

Text:
The long-time dream of the human civilization as a whole – to settle another world – has come true. To be among the people who made this happen makes me feel enthusiastic and proud.

We are already swarmed with applications for relocation on Mars and the wanderlust and enthusiasm of these people makes me proud to be a human being. The Red Planet continues to be inhospitable and even dangerous but we as a species had always displayed the ability to adapt and improve – the adverse conditions will only make us try harder. So I say bring it on!

<effect> The Colony has been evaluated positively. You can't call anymore colonists from Earth due to the Last Ark game rule.
Translation:
人類文明多年以來在外星球殖民的夢想終於成真了。我此刻的心情既激動又自豪，因為我也為實現這個夢想出了一份力。

我們已經收到無數人發來的移居火星的申請，這些人的熱情與探索欲令我因自己身為一名人類而深感驕傲。這顆紅色星球依然不適宜居住，甚至危機四伏，但我們這個種族一直以來都擁有適應與進步的能力，逆境只會催使我們迎難而上。世上無難事，只怕有心人！

<effect>殖民地得到了正面評價。由於最後的方舟遊戲規則，您無法從地球上運輸更多殖民地居民到火星。

Text: This will go down in history.

In this training exercise you will learn how to gather basic resources from the Martian surface, how to construct a small base and how to refuel the Rocket in order to send it back to Earth.

Let’s get started!

<effect><TutorialDisabledAchievementsText()>
Translation:
在此訓練關卡中您將學習如何搜集火星地表的基礎資源、如何建造小型基地、如何給火箭注入飛回地球所需的燃料。

準備開始吧！

<effect><TutorialDisabledAchievementsText()>
國際火星任務局模擬訓練

Text: <goal>Zoom in towards the suggested landing site.
Translation: <goal>放大螢幕，查看建議降落地點。

Text: You need to master the camera controls and familiarize yourself with the terrain around the prospective colony site.
Translation: 您需要掌握鏡頭控制。透過控制鏡頭，瞭解未來殖民地附近的地形情況。

Text:
Proceed by selecting the pinned icon representing the Rocket that is currently in orbit around Mars.

<goal>Land the Rocket on Mars.
Translation:
固定的圖示代表火箭。火箭目前正在環繞火星飛行，選擇火箭即可讓其降落。

<goal>將火箭降落在火星上吧。

Text: Now it's time to land your first Rocket.
Translation: 是時候讓您的第一艘火箭著陸了。
Old Text: Now it's time to land your first rocket.
Old Translation: 是時候讓您的第一艘火箭著陸了。

Text:
It carries Drones - remotely controlled robots which constitute your construction and resources gathering workforce.

Gathering basic resources for building construction is one of the first things our Martian base needs. Place a Metals Depot so the Drones begin automatically bringing Metals from the scattered surface deposits nearby.

<goal>Gather 5 Metals in a Metals Depot.
Translation:
火箭上裝有一些無人機，這種遠端遙控的機器人可以作為勞力，替您建造建築，搜集資源。

設定一處金屬倉庫，這樣無人機便可以自動從附近的地表資源點處搜集金屬。

<goal>將5單位金屬搜集至金屬倉庫中。

Text: ...and we have touchdown! The Rocket has landed on Mars.
Translation: ……順利降落！火箭已經降落在了火星上。

Text: <goal>Place a Universal Depot near your Rocket.
Translation: <goal>在火箭附近設定一處通用倉庫。
Old Text: <goal>Place a Universal Depot near your rocket.
Old Translation: <goal>在火箭附近設定一處通用倉庫。

Text: Our Rocket carries valuable resources that will be essential for the construction and maintenance of the Colony. Initially it's best to designate a Universal Depot, so the Drones have a place to store them.
Translation: 我們的火箭上裝載了貴重的資源，可以為殖民地的建造與維護提供必要基礎。遊戲開始時，最好可以設計一處通用倉庫，這樣無人機就可以將這些資源存放起來了。
Old Text: Our Rocket carries valuable resources that will be essential for the construction and maintenance of the Colony. Initially it's best to designate a Universal Depot so the Drones have a place to store them.
Old Translation: 我們的火箭上裝載了貴重的資源，可以為殖民地的建造與維護提供必要基礎。遊戲開始時，最好可以設計一處通用倉庫，這樣無人機就可以將這些資源存放起來了。

Text:
The Concrete Extractor building must be placed over or within proximity of a Concrete deposit.

<goal>From the build menu, select to build a Concrete Extractor and place it at the proposed location.
Translation:
混凝土挖掘站必須放置在混凝土資源點上或附近。

<goal>開啟建築選單，選擇建造混凝土挖掘站，把它放置在指定位置。

Text: Along with Metals, Concrete is the other vital basic construction resource.
Translation: 與金屬相似，混凝土是另一種非常重要的基礎建築資源。

Text:
Buildings are constructed by Drones. If you place a building outside the Drones' work range it won't be constructed. When placing buildings, make sure that those buildings are within range of drone controllers like the Rocket, Drone Hubs or RC Commanders.

You can select the Rocket to view its control radius.
Translation:
建築是由無人機建造。如果建築位置超出無人機範圍，無人機便無法建造建築。無人機控制中心包括火箭、無人機中心與遙控指揮車。在您設置建築時，請務必確保建築的位置處於上述控制中心的範圍內。

您可以選擇火箭，查看火箭的控制範圍。

Text: You are trying to place a construction outside of the work range of your Drones.
Translation: 您目前的建築位置已經超出了無人機的工作範圍。

Text:
Stirling Generators are excellent power sources but they are too complex to be built on Mars during the early stages of our colonization effort. That is why we ship them from Earth partially assembled in prefabs. Prefabs do not require any resources, only drones to unpack and assemble them.

We've provided you with a Stirling Generator prefab.

<goal>Construct a Stirling Generator and then connect it to the Concrete extractor with a Power Cable or place the Stirling Generator adjacent to the Concrete Extractor for a direct connection.
Translation:
斯特靈發電機可以有效提供電力，但它們的結構過於複雜，殖民地在發展初期還無法在火星上建造這種發電機。正因如此，我們才要以預製件的形式，將部分組裝的裝置從地球直接運過來。預製件不需要任何資源，只需要無人機進行展開和組裝。

我們已為您提供斯特靈發電機預製件。

<goal>建造一臺斯特靈發電機，之後，使用電纜將其與混凝土挖掘站相連，或將其與混凝土挖掘站直接鄰接。

Text: Like most buildings, the Concrete Extractor needs  power in order to operate. Having a reliable electrical grid and supply is essential for the success of the colony.
Translation: 與絕大部分建築類似，混凝土挖掘站需要電力才能正常運轉。想要讓殖民地蓬勃發展，可靠的電網系統與充足的電力供給必不可少。

Text:
The amount of Waste Rock per resource extracted depends on the Grade of the resource deposit. You can select a resource deposit to view its Grade and the amount of resources remaining in it.

<goal>Place a Dumping Site and a Concrete Depot to store the extracted Concrete.
Translation:
挖掘每單位資源產生的礦渣數量，取決於資源點本身的等級。您可以選擇資源點，查看資源點等級，以及資源點內殘餘資源數量。

<goal>在無人機工作範圍內，放置一座垃圾場與一座混凝土倉庫，即可儲存混凝土挖掘站產生的產品。

Text: Waste Rock and the Concrete Depot
Waste Rock is a byproduct of all extractors and is best stored at designated locations. This way you can ensure that it will not be in the way of future construction.
Translation: 所有的挖掘站都會產生礦渣這種副產品，最好將其存放在指定位置。只有這樣，這些礦渣才不會為未來的建設帶來麻煩。

Text:
Currently all Drones are assigned to the Rocket. When the Rocket is selected the work range of all Drones assigned to it will be visualized. If the Rocket takes off, however, all these Drones will need another controller.

<goal>Build a Drone Hub and make sure it is supplied with power.
Translation:
目前，所有的無人機都受火箭控制。當您選擇火箭之後，您可以看到火箭控制之下的所有無人機工作範圍。不過，如果火箭升空，則所有這些無人機需要新的控制器。

<goal>建造一座無人機中心並確保它得到電力供給。

Text: Drones will pick pending tasks on their own within the range of the drone controllers they are assigned to.
Translation: 只要處於所屬的無人機控制中心範圍內，無人機就會自動完成計劃列表中的任務。

Text:
Every Drone Hub has two Recharge Stations built-in, but you might need additional ones as the Colony spreads out. Constructing Recharge Stations, especially along areas with heavy Drone activity, will prove vital for maintaining an efficient work force.

<goal>Build a Recharge Station near the Concrete Extractor.
Translation:
每個無人機中心內部都設有兩座充電站。不過，隨著殖民地規模越來越大，您可能會需要更多充電站。對無人機活動頻繁的區域而言，建造充電站非常重要，它可以保障無人機的工作效率。

<goal>在混凝土挖掘站附近建造一座充電站。

Text: Drones run on batteries that have to be recharged periodically.
Translation: 無人機靠電池供電，需要時常進行充電。

Text:
Every Rocket has enough fuel for a one-way trip to Mars and has to be refueled on site, so it can return to Earth and be reused.
 
Fuel is produced in a Fuel Refinery. To setup the production chain, we will also need Water.

<goal>Build a Moisture Vaporator and then a Fuel Refinery.
Translation:
每個火箭的燃料都只夠地球到火星的單程飛行。只有當再次充滿燃料之後，才能返回地球，再次利用。

您可以在燃料精煉廠中生產燃料。為了準備生產線，我們還需要水資源。

<goal>建造一座水氣蒐集站，之後建造一座燃料精煉廠。

Text: Maintaining a steady supply chain between Earth and Mars is essential, especially during the early colonization stages.
Translation: 維持地球與火星之間供給穩定非常重要，尤其在殖民地發展的早期階段。

Text:
Luckily, we have an extra Stirling Generator Prefab we could use.

<goal>Build a new Stirling Generator along the power network.
Translation:
幸運的是，我們手上還有另一個斯特靈發電機的預製件。

<goal>在電網中建造一座新的斯特靈發電機。

Text: We don't have sufficient Power for all the buildings in the colony.
Translation: 我們的電力不足，無法為殖民地內所有建築提供能源。

Text:
The Moisture Vaporator has to be connected with Pipes to the Fuel Refinery. 

<goal>Connect the Moisture Vaporator to the Fuel Refinery with Pipes.
Translation:
您必須透過管線系統，將水氣蒐集站與燃料精煉廠連接在一起。

<goal>使用管線將水氣蒐集站與燃料精煉廠連接在一起。

Text: A system of Pipes is used to deliver resources such as Water and Air where they are needed.
Translation: 若想將水資源與氧氣運輸至需要的位置，您需要透過管線系統才能進行運輸。

Text:
Use the Speed Controls to increase the game speed, so the Rocket refuels faster.

<effect>For the purposes of this tutorial simulation the Rocket needs far less fuel (5) than it would during a normal playthrough (50).

<goal>Refuel the Rocket.
Translation:
您可以改變遊戲速度，這樣火箭的燃料補充速度也會加快。

<effect>為了避免浪費時間，本教學中火箭只需要5單位燃料便可以充滿。而在正常遊戲中，火箭需要50單位燃料才能充滿。

<goal>為火箭充滿燃料。

Text: Fuel production is now underway and the Drones will begin to deliver the Fuel to the Rocket.
Translation: 燃料已經開始生產了，無人機會將燃料運輸至火箭處。
進行下個教學 - “探測車、探索與研究”

Text: You've learned how to setup a basic outpost on Mars that can gather resources for further expansion and refuel Rockets. Using Rockets to bring in additional supplies from Earth is essential for a fledgling colony.
Translation: 您已經學會了如何在火星上建立一座能搜集資源的基礎前哨站，以供進一步擴張以及為火箭提供燃料之用。使用火箭從地球運來額外物資對新建立的殖民地至關重要。
Old Text: Now that you know how to handle the basics of your mission you are qualified to continue with the more advanced tutorials.
Old Translation: 現在，您已瞭解如何應對任務中的基本問題，可以準備進行更高階的教學了。

Text: Congratulations, you have finished the first tutorial!
Translation: 恭喜，您完成了第一個教學！

Text:
Rovers are vehicles with a variety of useful functions like transporting resources, commanding Drones and analyzing Anomalies. You have direct control over all Rovers in the colony.

<goal>Select the RC Transport and move it to the designated area.
Translation:
探測車是一種擁有多種功能的載具，包括運輸資源、控制無人機以及分析異象。您可以直接控制殖民地中所有探測車。

<goal>選擇遙控運輸車，將其移動至指定位置。

Text: Welcome, Commander! In this training exercise you will get acquainted with one of your most valuable tools - Rovers.
Translation: 歡迎您，指揮官！在這個教學中，您將會逐漸熟悉探測車這種極有價值的工具。

Text:
Use the RC Transport to load Fuel from the fuel depot in the base, then unload it close to the Rocket, so that its drones can load it into the rocket.

Drones can also take resources directly from the RC Transport if they need them, however unloading the resources is quicker and will free up the RC Transport for other tasks.

<goal>Load Fuel on to the RC Transport and unload it next to the Rocket.
Translation:
使用遙控運輸車，從基地的燃料倉庫中裝載燃料。之後將燃料解除安裝至火箭附近的位置，這樣無人機就可以為火箭補充燃料了。

如果需要的話，無人機也可以直接從遙控運輸車中獲得資源。不過解除安裝資源速度更快，而且解除安裝完畢之後，遙控運輸車就可以去執行其它任務了。

<goal>使用遙控運輸車裝載燃料，並把燃料解除安裝至火箭附近。

Text: The RC Transport can load and carry resources around the map. Let's use it to refuel the nearby Rocket.
Translation: 遙控運輸車可以在地圖上裝載資源、運輸資源。使用它為附近的火箭填滿燃料吧。

Text:
If Drones lose their controller they will look for new controllers nearby. However, when there are no controllers nearby you'll have to manually reassign them to a new controller.

The "Reassign" command also allows you to reassign Drones to understaffed controllers with heavy Drone load.

<goal>Assign these Drones to the nearby Drone Hub.
Translation:
失去控制者的無人機會自動尋找附近其它的控制者。不過，如果附近沒有控制者的話，您需要手動將它們重新指派至新的控制者處。

此外，您也可以透過“重新指派”命令，從快要滿員的無人機控制者處，抽調一部分無人機去別的地方。

<goal>將這些無人機指派至附近的無人機中心處。

Text: Some Drones are left without a controller after the Rocket launch.
Translation: 火箭發射之後，部分無人機會失去控制者。

Text:
Send the RC Transport to gather some Metals from the deposit indicated by the arrow.

<goal>Gather 5 Metals with the RC Transport.
Translation:
指派遙控運輸車，前往箭頭指示的資源點處採集部分金屬資源。

<goal>使用遙控運輸車採集5單位金屬

Text: The RC Transport is able to gather resources directly from surface deposits without the help of Drones.
Translation: 遙控運輸車可以在不需要無人機的情況下，直接從地表資源點處採集資源。

Text:
We will need resources for the new base. The RC Transport can be ordered to transfer a large amount of resources in multiple goes via the "Create Transport Route" command.

<goal>Set a transport route between the Universal Storage in the base and the marked location above the main base.
Translation:
我們需要資源才能建造新的基地。您可以透過“建立運輸路線”命令，派遣遙控運輸車多次運輸大量資源到指定位置。

<goal>在基地的通用倉庫與主基地上方標記的位置之間，建立一條運輸路線。
遙控運輸車 - 運輸路線

Text: Let's set up a small expand some distance away from the main base.
Translation: 現在，讓我們前往離基地更遠一些的位置吧。

Text:
The RC Commander is a mobile drone controller that carries its own drones. With its help you can gather resources from surface deposits, construct and maintain buildings.

When moving far distances the RC Commander will first recall its drones before moving off to its destination.

<goal>Move the RC Commander to the site of the expand.
Translation:
遙控指揮車就是一座移動式無人機控制中心，自身也會攜帶一部分無人機。藉助遙控指揮車，您就可以採集地表資源點的資源、建造以及維護建築物。

遙控指揮車進行遠距離移動時，會先召回無人機，再移動到目的地。

<goal>將遙控指揮車移動到擴張地點。

Old Text: RC Rover
Old Translation: 遙控探測車

Text:
Use the resources that the RC Transport delivered to build and power a new Sensor Tower that will help us scan the nearby locations for new resources and Anomalies.

<goal> Construct a Sensor Tower and a Stirling Generator to power it.
Translation:
使用遙控運輸車運輸的資源，建造一座新的感應塔，並為其提供電力。這樣一來，我們就可以掃描附近的區域，探索新的資源與異象了。

<goal>建造一座感應塔，再建造一座斯特靈發電機為其提供電力。

Text: We need to construct a new Sensor Tower to scan the nearby environment.
Translation: 我們需要建造一座感應塔，掃描附近的區域。

Text:
You can scan new sectors to discover more resource deposits and Anomalies. This is done from the Map Overview.

<goal>Go to the Map Overview.
Translation:
您可以透過掃描區域，發現更多資源點與異象。您可以在地圖總覽介面掃描區域。

<goal>進入地圖總覽介面

Text: It is time to learn about scanning sectors and exploration.
Translation: 是時候學習如何掃描區域，探索區域了。

Text:
There are two main ways to scan - one is to queue sectors for scanning. These sectors will be scanned one by one gradually over time. Sensor Towers speed up the scanning process of sectors near them.

The other way is to use Probes which you can buy using funding and bring on resupply Rockets from Earth.

<goal>Use a Probe to explore a sector.
Translation:
掃描主要有兩種方式，其中一種是將區域置入掃描佇列中。佇列中的區域會依次逐步進行掃描。感應塔可以加快附近區域的掃描進度。

另一種掃描方式是使用探測器進行掃描。您可以透過重新補給火箭，使用資金從地球上購買探測器。

<goal>使用探測器掃描區域。

Text: You can scan sectors of the map to discover new resources and Anomalies.
Translation: 您可以掃描地圖區域，發現新的資源與異象。

Text:
Select the RC Explorer and use the "Move/Interact" action to order it to analyze the Anomaly. This will take a while, so consider increasing the game speed to fastest.

<goal>Use the RC Explorer to analyze the Anomaly.
Translation:
選擇遙控探索者，使用“移動/互動”指令，派遣探索者對異象進行分析。分析異象需要消耗一定時間，您可以考慮將遊戲速度提升到最快。

<goal>使用遙控探索者分析異象。

Text: Well done! Now it's time to use our fully operational RC Explorer to analyze the Anomaly.
Translation: 幹得漂亮！我們的遙控探索者已經馬力全開，使用它分析異象吧。

Text:
Researching new technologies unlocks new options for the colony such as new Buildings, Domes and Upgrades.

Anomalies often provide bonuses to research, such as unlocking new technologies for research or providing Research Points.

<goal>Open the Research Screen.
Translation:
研究新的技術，即可為殖民地解鎖新的選項，包括新的建築、新的穹頂、新的升級。

異象通常都能為研究帶來加成效果，例如解鎖新的科技，或提供研究點數等。

<goal>開啟研究介面。

Text: The Anomaly has yielded interesting insights into new technologies.
Translation: 異象為新的技術提供了非常有趣的啟迪。

Text:
Techs are divided into five basic fields and a field for special breakthrough Techs. When you research a Tech from a given basic field you will unlock a new tech in that field. Breakthrough techs are special unique techs that are unlocked via Anomalies.

<goal>Queue at least one technology for research.
Translation:
所有技術分為五個基礎領域，還有一個專門留給突破性技術的額外領域。當您研究某個基礎領域的技術之後，便可以解鎖該領域內的新技術。突破性技術為獨特的技術，只能透過分析異象來解鎖。

<goal>至少將一個需要研究的技術加入佇列中。

Text: This is the Research screen. From here you can choose and queue techs for Research.
Translation: 這裡就是研究介面。您可以在這裡選擇需要研究的技術佇列。
Old Text: This is the Research screen. From here you can chose and queue techs for Research.
Old Translation: 這裡就是研究介面。您可以在這裡選擇需要研究的技術佇列。

Text:
