Each tech has a cost in Research Points which are generated in various ways. Your sponsor provides some Research Points to start with. Once colonists arrive you will be able to construct Research Labs which generate Research Points faster.

You can view a breakdown of the Research Points generated per Sol on the right side of the Research screen.

<goal>Close the Research screen to complete this tutorial.
Translation:
每項技術需要花費一定的研究點數，研究點數能透過若干種方式產生。首先，您的贊助者會提供一定量的研究點數。殖民地居民到達後，您就可以建造能以更快速度產生研究點數的研究實驗室。

您可以在研究介面右側查看每個太陽日產生的研究點數明細。

<goal>關閉研究介面即可完成本教學。
進行下個教學 - “電力、水資源與維護”

Text: In this tutorial you learned how to command and use the different Rover vehicles at your disposal as well as how to scan sectors and how to research new technologies.
Translation: 在本教學中，您將會學習如何使用各式各樣的探測車載具，如何掃描區域，以及如何研究新的技術。

Text: Nice work! Now you know how to handle Rovers.
Translation: 幹得漂亮！您已經學會如何使用探測車了。

Text:
Now it is your job to fix it up and prepare it for the first Colonists.

In this tutorial you will learn how to handle Power, Life Support grids and Building maintenance as well as how to construct your first Dome.
Translation:
現在，您需要修復基地，準備迎接第一批殖民地居民。

在本教學中，您將會學習如何建造電網與生命維持供應網路，如何進行建築維護，以及如何建造您的第一個穹頂。

Text: Welcome Commander! It looks like this forward base has gone through a major dust storm.
Translation: 歡迎您，指揮官！前面的基地似乎經歷了一場大規模沙塵暴。

Text:
This Concrete Extractor has depleted its deposit and will be of no use now. We can salvage some construction materials from it.

<goal>Salvage the Concrete Extractor.
Translation:
這個混凝土挖掘站已經採光了資源點中的資源，不會再派上用場了。我們可以回收這座建築，獲得一部分建築資源。

<goal>回收混凝土挖掘站。

Text: First things first! Let's remove some unnecessary structures.
Translation: 先做重要的事情吧！我們先來移除一部分不需要的建築吧。

Text:
We need to supply the Drone Hub with Power. The resources from the salvaged Concrete Extractor should be enough to construct a Solar Panel. It would be best to use the existing Power Cables to connect the two buildings and avoid wasting more Metals on Cables.

<goal>Power the Drone Hub with the help of a Solar Panel.
Translation:
我們需要為無人機中心提供電力。從混凝土挖掘站回收而來的資源，應該足夠建造一座太陽能板了。我們最好使用既有的電纜連接這兩座建築，避免在電纜上浪費額外的金屬資源。

<goal>使用太陽能板為無人機中心提供電力。
為無人機中心提供電力

Text: Now let's get that Drone Hub operational.
Translation: 現在，讓無人機中心開始運轉吧。
Old Text: Now lets get that Drone Hub operational.
Old Translation: 現在，讓無人機中心開始運轉吧。

Text:
You can change the Priority of buildings manually. Buildings on higher Priority get Power, Maintenance and workers first. 

<goal>Set the Drone Hub to High Priority.
Translation:
您可以手動更換建築的優先順序。優先順序較高的建築可以優先獲得電力、維護與工人。

<goal>將無人機中心設定為高優先順序。

Text: We have some Power but it's not enough. We should prioritize the Drone Hub.
Translation: 我們已經有了一部分電力，但還不夠。我們應該將電力優先提供給無人機中心。

Text:
Wind Turbines are a good alternative to Solar Panels as they operate day and night. They also get bonus Power production if built on high ground. However Wind Turbines have high upkeep cost and require maintenance more often than Solar Panels.

<goal>Construct a Wind Turbine and connect it to the existing Power network.
Translation:
風力發電機是太陽能板之外的另一種發電裝置，它晝夜都可以運轉。當風力發電機建造在較高的地勢上時，還能獲得額外電力產量。不過，與太陽能板相比，風力發電機的維護費用更高，需要進行維護的頻率也會更高。

<goal>建造一座風力發電機，將它連接至既有的電網中。

Text: We can use the Machine Parts left from the Concrete Extractor to build a Wind Turbine.
Translation: 我們可以使用從混凝土挖掘站回收的機械零件建造一座風力發電機。
Old Text: We can use the Machine Parts left from the Concrete Extractor to build a Wind Turbine
Old Translation: 我們可以使用從混凝土挖掘站回收的機械零件建造一座風力發電機。

Text:
Solar Panels provide power only during the day and we don't have Accumulators to compensate at night. You can set some of the base buildings to automatically turn off at night using the building's shifts. 

There are three shifts - First Shift, Second Shift and Night Shift. Buildings will require Power, Resources and workers only during their active shifts.

<goal>Disable the Night Shifts of the Moisture Vaporator and Fuel Refinery.
Translation:
太陽能板只能在白天提供電力，而我們也沒有蓄電池，無法在夜間獲得電力補充。您可以透過建築班次功能，設定基地裡的建築自動關閉夜班班次。

建築一共有三個班次：早班、中班與夜班。只有當建築處於啟用的班次中時，才會需要電力、資源與工人。

<goal>您可以關閉水氣蒐集站與燃料精煉廠的夜班班次。

Text: Even with the Wind Turbine there won't be enough electricity to power the base, especially during the night.
Translation: 即便是有了風力發電機，您的基地的電力也會不足，尤其是在夜間。

Text:
Buildings require maintenance with Resources roughly every 6 or 7 Sols. Buildings that don't get maintenance break and won't function until repaired.

To showcase this we have simulated a breakdown of your Solar Panel. Drones will automatically repair this breakdown provided that there are Metals in range of their controller.

<goal>Examine the broken down Solar Panel.
Translation:
大約每隔6至7個太陽日，建築就需要消耗資源進行維護。沒有得到維護的建築會損壞，損壞的建築在修復之前是無法運轉的。

為了展示這一效果，我們已經模擬您的太陽能板出現了故障。當無人機控制者範圍內有足夠的金屬時，無人機會自動對損壞的建築進行修復。

<goal>檢查損壞的太陽能板。

Text: You managed to get things operational, but this won't last as buildings require maintenance and we are out of Resources.
Translation: 您成功地讓一切步入了正規，但這種狀態不會持續太久。因為建築需要進行維護，而我們的資源已經耗盡了。

Text:
The RC Transport can mine surface Metal deposits. Use it to gather 20-30 Metals and bring them back to the base. 

You can then use these Metals to setup additional Solar Panels and power up everything.

<goal>Deliver at least 20 Metals to the base with the help of the RC Transport.
Translation:
遙控運輸車可以採集地表金屬資源。使用遙控運輸車採集20 - 30單位金屬，並將它們帶回基地。

您可以使用這些金屬建造新的太陽能板，為基地裡所有建築提供電力。

<goal>使用遙控運輸車，將至少20單位金屬帶回基地。
遙控運輸車 - 採集金屬

Text: We need more Metals to secure this base. Use the RC Transport to collect some Metals and transport them back.
Translation: 我們需要更多金屬才能保障這座基地的運轉。使用遙控運輸車採集部分金屬，將它們運回基地吧。

Text:
Using Rockets to resupply from Earth is the best way to secure Resources early on. You'll need funding to buy the Resources but your sponsor usually will provide you with enough to get a basic colony up and running.

<goal>Open the Resupply screen and order Advanced resources from Earth.
Translation:
在殖民地初期，確保資源充足的最佳方式，就是透過火箭從地球獲得重新補給。您需要一定資金來購買資源，但您的贊助者通常都會向您提供足夠的資源，讓您的殖民地可以發展運營。

<goal>開啟重新補給介面，從地球購買高階資源。

Text: Good job! However we need more than just Metals. Fortunately we can call a resupply Rocket from Earth.
Translation: 幹得漂亮！然而，我們需要的資源不僅僅是金屬。幸運的是，我們可以從地球申請重新補給火箭。

Text:
The remains of destroyed or salvaged Buildings will obstruct other constructions. To clear such ruins you'll need to research the "Decommission Protocol" technology in the Engineering field. For the purposes of this simulation we have provided you with the tech.

<goal>Clear the ruins of the Concrete Extractor.
Translation:
被破壞或被回收的建築殘骸會對其它建築工作造成阻礙。若想要清除這類建築廢墟，您需要研究工程領域中的“關停協定”技術。出於模擬需要，我們已經向您提供了這項技術。

<goal>清除混凝土挖掘站的廢墟。

Text: Let's do some cleaning up around the base while we wait for the Rocket to arrive.
Translation: 趁火箭抵達之前，我們先清理一下基地附近的建築吧。

Text:
You can use the Salvage tools in the Build Menu to remove Cables and Pipes, as well as an alternative way to salvage Buildings.

<goal>Remove the Cables that were connected to the Concrete Extractor.
Translation:
您可以使用建築選單中的回收工具來移除電纜與管線，也同樣可以用這個辦法來回收建築。

<goal>移除與混凝土挖掘站相連的電纜。

Text: Now let's remove some of the unnecessary Cables.
Translation: 現在，讓我們清除一部分不需要的電纜吧。

Text:
Let's start with a Power Accumulator - it allows you to store power for nighttime or emergencies. Keep in mind that accumulators have a capped maximum output so a single one may not be enough to power all Buildings at night.

<goal>Construct a Power Accumulator and connect it to the Power grid.

<hint>You may want to construct some additional Solar Panels and Wind Turbines in advance to sustain the base expansion.
Translation:
先從建造蓄電池開始吧，蓄電池可以讓你儲備電力，以備晚上或緊急事態時使用。要記住，蓄電池都有最大電力輸出限制。因此若只有一個蓄電池，可能不足以為所有建築提供夜間電力。

<goal>建造一個蓄電池，將其連接在電網中。

<hint>為了保障基地可以順利擴張，您可能需要建造一些額外的太陽能板或風力發電機。

Text: The supplies from Earth have arrived and we can use them to expand the base.
Translation: 從地球運來的補給已經到了，我們可以利用這些資源擴張基地。

Text:
Let us build a Water Extractor near the deposit. All Extractors must be placed near a deposit of the corresponding type. Remember to then connect it with Power. You may also have to build more Power producers to generate the required Power.

<goal>Construct and power a Water Extractor.
Translation:
在資源點附近建造一處水資源吧。挖掘站必須與資源點的類型相匹配。請記住這一點，之後，您還需要為挖掘站提供電力。您可能需要建造更多電站，才能為挖掘站提供需要的電力。

<goal>建造一座水資源挖掘站，並為其提供電力。

Text: Water is essential for a sustainable Martian colony. Fortunately there is a Water deposit nearby.
Translation: 對火星殖民地的生存而言，水資源必不可少。幸運的是，附近就有一處水資源點。

Text:
We will need Water for Domes, Farming and Polymer production but for now we don't have any of that so we can store some water in a Water Tower. Storages are important safety measures for your colony as they will provide Water, Oxygen or Power in the case of a producer breaking down or ceasing operation during a disaster.

<goal>Construct a Water Tower and connect it to the Water Extractor with Pipes.
Translation:
水資源可以用來供給穹頂，用於種植農作物或用於聚合物的生產，但我們目前並沒有這些裝置。因此，我們可以先把水資源儲存在水塔中。對您的殖民地而言，電力、水資源與氧氣的儲存建築是非常重要的安全手段。它們可以在產能建築出現故障，或由於災害而停產時，為殖民地提供備用資源。

<goal>建造一座水塔，並使用管線將其連接至水資源挖掘站處。

Text: The Water Extractor is ready but we don't have a storage for the Water it will extract.
Translation: 水資源挖掘站已經建好了，但我們並沒有相應的儲水裝置。

Text:
Domes are large superstructures that house Colonists. You can construct many buildings inside Domes. Some of them will require Colonists as workforce. Domes have limited space but can be connected via Passages to form larger systems.

Remember to use the RC Transport to mine Metals and to call resupply Rockets if you need Advanced resources to finish the Dome.

<goal>Construct a Basic Dome. This will take a long time so you might wish to speed things up with the speed controls.
Translation:
穹頂是大型建築，可以為殖民地居民提供住處。您還可以在穹頂內部建造許多其它建築。其中一部分建築需要殖民地居民工作。單個穹頂空間有限，但您可以使用通道將穹頂連接在一起，組成規模更大的穹頂系統。

別忘了，如果建造穹頂的過程需要高階資源，您可以使用遙控運輸車採集金屬，或呼叫重新補給火箭。

<goal>建造一座基礎穹頂。建造穹頂會消耗很長時間，您可能需要用速度控制來加快遊戲速度。

Text: The time has finally come to build the first Dome that will house our Colonists.
Translation: 終於該建造第一座穹頂了，穹頂可以為殖民地居民提供住處。

Text:
Domes require life-support. Namely Water, Power and Oxygen. Connect the Dome to the existing Power and Water infrastructure. You may need to build additional Power producers.

For Oxygen you will need to construct a MOXIE - a device that extracts Oxygen from the carbon dioxide in the Martian atmosphere. Once the MOXIE is ready and powered up connect it to the Dome with Pipes. It may be wise to build an Oxygen Storage as well.

<goal>Provide Water, Power and Oxygen to the Dome.
Translation:
穹頂需要生命維持資源，也就是水資源、電力與氧氣。將穹頂連接至現有的電力與水資源基礎設施中。您可能需要建造額外的發電建築。

至於氧氣，您需要建造一座氧氣生成裝置，這種裝置可以從火星大氣中的二氧化碳中開採氧氣。建好氧氣生成裝置之後，您需要為它提供電力，並用管線將其連接至穹頂處。另外，建造一座氧氣儲存裝置可能會是個好主意。

<goal>為穹頂提供水資源、電力與氧氣。
穹頂 - 水資源、電力與氧氣

Text: The Dome is complete but we have to supply it with Water, Power and Oxygen before we can use it.
Translation: 穹頂已經完成，但我們需要為它提供水資源、電力與氧氣才能使用。
進行下個教學 - “殖民地居民”

Text:
You have learned how to handle Power, Water and Oxygen, as well as how building maintenance works. You are ready to setup a basic colony, ready to accept the first human pioneers on Mars.

The next tutorial deals with Colonists and their needs. You can continue to it now or simply start a new game and return later when you are ready to learn more.
Translation:
您已經學會了如何處理電力、水資源與氧氣，也瞭解了建築維護工作。您已經準備好建立基礎殖民地，接納火星上的首批人類先驅們了。

下個教學將與殖民地居民和居民需求相關。您可以選擇繼續教學，或直接開始新遊戲，等您準備學習更多內容時再返回教學。

Text: Well done! You have completed the simulation successfully.
Translation: 幹得漂亮！您已經成功地完成了模擬訓練。

Text:
Everything done beforehand was a prelude to this very moment – the arrival of The Founders. 

Our first Colonists are called Founders. After they set foot on Mars, a trial period meant to test how humans fare on Mars will begin. No more Colonists will arrive from Earth until the Founder stage ends. Be careful, if all of your Colonists die during this period the mission will be terminated. 

Best of luck, Commander!
Translation:
您之前的所有準備，都是為了這一重要時刻 – 迎接創始者們的到來。 

我們最初的殖民地居民被稱為創始者。創始者們會考察人類在火星上的居住情況。當創始者來到火星之後，考察階段就會開始。在創始者階段結束之前，不會有新的居民從地球前往火星。 

祝您好運，指揮官！

Text: Welcome back, Commander! In this tutorial you will finally familiarize yourself with the challenges of sustaining a society on Mars.
Translation: 歡迎回來，指揮官！在本教學中，您將逐漸適應火星殖民地生存發展的一系列挑戰。

Text:
Living Complexes are built inside the Dome. The space within the Dome is limited, so each building has to be carefully planned.

<goal>Construct a Living Complex at the indicated location.
Translation:
你可以在穹頂內部建造複合式住宅。每個穹頂內部空間非常有限，因此你需要精心設計每個建築的位置。

<goal>在指定位置建造複合式住宅。

Text: The foundations for bringing your first Colonists have already been laid down. One of the final things left to do is to provide the Founders with living space.
Translation: 您已經做好了迎接第一批殖民地居民的準備。您需要做的最後一件事情，是為創始者們提供居住空間。

Text: <goal>Order a Passenger Rocket from the Resupply screen.
Translation: <goal>開啟重新補給介面，預定一艘客運火箭。

Text: With all preparations complete, the Colony is ready for the arrival of the Founders.
Translation: 當一切準備就緒後，殖民地將會迎接創始者們的到來。

Text:
Colonists are organized by their age, specialization and various traits. You can set desired and undesired traits in every category using the Thumbs Up and Thumbs Down icons.

Colonists with MORE of the desired traits will board the Rocket while colonists with ANY undesired traits will be rejected.
Translation:
所有殖民地居民都可以透過年齡、專長與各式各樣的特性進行分類。您可以透過大拇指圖示，在每個類別中選擇需要或不需要的特性。

具有更多需要特性的居民會登上火箭；與此同時，只要居民具有任何一項不需要的特性，就會被拒絕進入。

Text: From this screen you can inspect all available applicants and determine which ones will travel to the Colony.
Translation: 在這個介面中，您可以看到所有可用的應徵者，並選擇讓哪些應徵者來到您的殖民地。

Text: By highlighting individual applicants one by one you can review their Perks and Flaws. It may be a good idea to do this for the Founders in order to get an exact number of specialists you desire as well as hand pick the traits of these Colonists.
Translation: 您可以用逐個標記個別應徵者的方式審核他們的特長和缺陷。如果您想精準控制專家人數並親手為殖民地居民們選擇特性，逐個審核或許會是個不錯的選擇。
Old Text: The Review option allows you to view individual applicants one by one and review their Perks and Flaws. It may be a good idea to do this for the Founders in order to get an exact number of specialists you desire as well as hand pick the traits of these Colonists. The Review page will show you all Colonists that fit the criteria of the filter set in the previous page.
Old Translation: 您可以在審核選單中逐個瀏覽應徵者的個人履歷，查看每個人各自的特長與缺陷。如果您想嚴格挑選專家們的數量，親手為殖民地居民們選擇特性，逐個審核或許會是個不錯的選擇。在審核選單中，您可以看到符合所有上一頁篩選標準的殖民地居民。

Text: You may want to review and hand pick individual candidates for the Founders.
Translation: 或許您希望能親自審核應徵者，親自挑選出第一批創始者。

Text: <goal>Construct a Hydroponic Farm and a Grocer inside your Dome.
Translation: <goal>在您的穹頂內部建造一座水耕農場和一座雜貨店。
Old Text: <goal>Construct a Hydroponic Farm and a Grocery inside your Dome.
Old Translation: <goal>在您的穹頂內部建造一座水耕農場和一座雜貨店。

Text: Colonists will arrive on Mars with a small amount of Food, but it will not last long. We need to make sure that they will be able to produce their own Food on the red planet. The Hydroponic Farm can produce Food. Although the Colonists can take Food directly from a Food Depot, they will be happier if they can pick it up from a Grocer.
Translation: 前往火星的居民們會隨身攜帶一部分食物，但食物無法支撐太長時間。我們必須確保火星的居民們能實現食物自給自足。水耕農場可以生產食物。儘管殖民地居民可以直接從食物倉庫中獲取食物，但如果能從雜貨店中獲得食物，他們會感到更加開心。
Old Text: Colonists will arrive on Mars with a small amount of Food, but it will not last long. We need to make sure that they will be able to produce their own Food on the red planet. The Hydroponic Farm can produce Food. Although the Colonists can take Food directly from a Food Depot, they will be happier if they can pick it up from a Grocery.
Old Translation: 前往火星的居民們會隨身攜帶一部分食物，但食物無法支撐太長時間。我們必須確保火星的居民們能實現食物自給自足。水耕農場可以生產食物。儘管殖民地居民可以直接從食物倉庫中獲取食物，但如果能從雜貨店中獲得食物，他們會感到更加開心。

Text:
Different services satisfy different interests colonists may have. A colonist will feel more comfortable inside a Dome which has his interests covered but you don't need to cover every interest and in smaller Dome this might not be even possible.

If the comfort of colonists falls too low they may become Earthsick and decide to leave Mars and go back to Earth. However, Martianborn colonists will never get Earthsick.

<goal>Construct a Spacebar inside the Dome.
Translation:
不同的服務建築可以滿足居民不同的興趣。當穹頂中含有可以滿足居民興趣的建築時，居民的舒適度會更高。但您並不需要在每個小型穹頂中都建造可以滿足各種興趣的全套設施，這個目標可能也根本不切實際。

如果居民的舒適度過低，他們可能會患上思鄉病，會想要離開火星，回到地球。不過，火星出生的居民是不會患上思鄉病的。

<goal>在穹頂內建造一座星際酒吧。

Text: Colonists need service buildings to keep them comfortable on Mars. The Grocer that you already constructed is one such service building.
Translation: 殖民地居民們需要服務建築，以保證火星生活的舒適度。您建造的雜貨店就屬於這種服務建築。
Old Text: Colonists need service buildings to keep them comfortable on Mars. The Grocery that you already constructed is one such service building.
Old Translation: 殖民地居民們需要服務建築，以保證火星生活的舒適度。您建造的雜貨店就屬於這種服務建築。

Text:
The Founders that just arrived have taken available jobs automatically, but you can customize their work assignments.

With the building selected, notice the three available work shifts on the info panel. Two of them are active, with two workers employed at each shift.

The more workers assigned to a building, the better the building performes. Initially, however, we won’t be needing so many people working at the Space Bar as there will be other important jobs to fill and limited people to fill them – especially during the Founder Stage.

<goal>Disable one job slot in every active shift.
Translation:
剛剛到來的創始者們會自動擔任可以擔任的工作，但您也可以自定義居民們的工作設定。

選擇建築之後，您可以在資訊面板中看到三班工作班次。其中有兩個班次是啟用的，每個班次有兩名工人。

指派到一座建築物的工人越多，該建築物的工作效率越高。不過在遊戲初期，我們並不需要這麼多人在星際酒吧中工作，因為居民數量有限，還有更重要的工作等待他們完成。尤其在創始者階段更是如此。

<goal>在每個啟用班次中，都取消一個工作欄位。

Text: Great! Now that you have a Spacebar you can customize its work settings.
Translation: 幹得漂亮！您已經建好了星際酒吧，可以自定義它的工作設定了。

Text:
Some buildings are more effective with workers with a certain specialization. For example, Scientists are the best workers for a Research Lab.

<goal>Construct a Research Lab inside the Dome.
Translation:
擁有特定特長的居民，在某些崗位上的工作表現會更加出色。例如，科學家最適合在研究實驗室中工作。

<goal>在穹頂內部建造一座研究實驗室。

Text: Healthy colonists at working age are able to fill any position but how well they perform at a certain position varies between colonists.
Translation: 適齡的健康居民可以參與所有工作，不過在工作崗位上的表現卻因人而異。

Text:
Colonists don't like to work at night and will lose Sanity while doing so. Furthermore, you may activate the Heavy Workload option which boosts the performance of a building during that shift but inflicts Sanity and Health problems on the workers due to the increased stress at their job.

<goal> With the Research Lab selected, activate the second Work Shift.
Translation:
殖民地居民不喜歡在夜間工作，在夜間工作時會損失理智度。不僅如此，您可以啟動高負荷工作選項。這可以增加建築的工作效率，但由於工作強度提高，在高負荷班次中工作的工人，理智度與生命值都會受到影響。

<goal>選擇研究實驗室後，啟用中班工作班次。

Text: Work Shifts, among other things, are a way to manage your work force. The more shifts a building has open the more colonists it will attract to work there.
Translation: 您可以透過工作班次與其它設定，管理您的勞動力。建築擁有的工作班次越多，吸引至此工作的居民就會越多。

Text:
On-site research is very important for the long-term prosperity and survival of your colony, so let us prioritize it!

<goal>Set the priority of the Research Lab to High.
Translation:
對殖民地的長期發展與生存而言，現場研究工作至關重要。因此，來提高它的優先順序吧！

<goal>將研究實驗室的設定為高優先順序。

Text: Buildings with higher priority will be allocated workers, Power and Maintenance before others.
Translation: 優先順序較高的建築會優先配置電力、維護與工人。

Text: <goal>From the Research screen, queue at least three of the available technologies.
Translation: <goal>在研究介面中，將至少三項可研究技術加入佇列中。

Text: With the Research Lab up and running let's begin researching some technologies.
Translation: 研究實驗室已經準備就緒，來研究一些新技術吧。

Text:
The Founder Stage takes ten Sols to complete. Be careful, if all of your colonists die during this period the mission will be terminated. 

Having a baby born on Mars before the end of this period will also complete the Founder Stage. This can happen if the comfort of your Colonists is very high.
Translation:
創始者階段需要十個太陽日。要注意，如果您所有的殖民地居民都在這個階段喪命的話，任務將會中止。

在創始者階段結束前，若在火星上誕生了新的嬰兒，創始者階段同樣會順利完成。只有當您的居民舒適度非常高時，才會誕生新的嬰兒。

Text: Congratulations! You have provided everything needed for a successful Founder Stage.
Translation: 恭喜！您已經為創始者階段做好了萬全的準備。

Text: Normally the Founder Stage takes ten Sols to complete, but you have performed beyond expectations as the first born Martian baby proves. The founder stage is now over and you are free to invite more colonists to Mars.
Translation: 創始者階段通常需要十個太陽日才能完成，但您的殖民地成功地誕生了第一位火星上的嬰兒，這已經超出了預期結果。創始者階段即刻完成，您可以自由邀請更多殖民地居民前往火星。

Text: Congratulations! A baby has been born on Mars and the Founder stage is completed!
Translation: 恭喜！一個嬰兒在火星上呱呱墜地！創始者階段順利完成！
進行下個教學 - “多個穹頂”

Text:
The Founder Stage takes ten Sols to complete normally, but for the purposes of this tutorial it has already been completed.

In the next and final tutorial you will learn how to manage a larger colony, consisting of multiple Domes.
Translation:
在正常遊戲中，創始者階段需要十個太陽日才能完成。但由於是教學部分，創始者階段已經提前完成。

下個教學是教學的最後一部分，您將會學習如何管理含有多個穹頂的大型殖民地。

Text: You have completed the tutorial for the Founder Stage.
Translation: 您已經成功完成了創始者階段的教學部分。

Text: As you expand your base and try to obtain various resources scattered across the map you will inevitably end up with a colony that consists of several Domes. This tutorial will introduce you to a lot of the typical situations that you can expect to come up in a big colony.
Translation: 隨著您的基地不斷擴展，不斷採集散佈在地圖上的各種資源，您的殖民地最終一定會擁有若干座穹頂。這部分教學將向您介紹多種會在大型殖民地中時常遇到的狀況。
Old Text: As you expand your base and try to obtain various resources scattered across the map you will inevitably end up with a colony that consists of several Domes. This tutorial will introduce you to several of the typical situations that you can expect to come up in such larger colony.
Old Translation: 隨著您的基地不斷擴展，不斷採集散佈在地圖上的各種資源，您的殖民地最終一定會擁有許多座穹頂。。這部分教學將向您介紹一些會在大型殖民地中時常遇到的狀況。

Text: Welcome back, Commander! In this tutorial you will manage a larger colony that consists of multiple Domes.
Translation: 歡迎回來，指揮官！在這個教學中，您將管理擁有多座穹頂的大型殖民地。
Old Text: Welcome back Commander! In this tutorial you will manage a larger colony that consists of multiple Domes.
Old Translation: 歡迎回來，指揮官！在這個教學中，您將會管理含有多個穹頂的大型殖民地。

Text:
The complex technology needed for Shuttles flying in the thin Martian atmosphere typically must be researched. For the purposes of this tutorial, however, it has been already granted to you.

<goal>Construct a Shuttle Hub.
Translation:
您需要先研究相關複雜技術，使穿梭機可以在火星稀薄的大氣層中飛行，之後才能使用穿梭機。不過，出於教學訓練的目的，您已經獲得了這項科技。

<goal>建造一座穿梭機中心。

Text: Shuttles can transport resources and colonists across great distances.
Translation: 穿梭機可以穿梭於很遠的距離之間，運輸資源與殖民地居民。

Text:
Colonists can work in some outside buildings placed close to their Domes - such as extractors for Metals and Rare Metals. Since colonists will be needed for the extraction of these underground deposits, it is a good practice to place Domes near such deposits, as is the case in this simulation.

<goal>Construct a Rare Metals Extractor next to the Rare Metals Deposit and connect it to the power grid.
Translation:
殖民地居民可以在穹頂之外距離較近的部分建築中工作，例如金屬挖掘站與稀有金屬挖掘站。由於這些地下資源點需要居民進入工作，將穹頂安置在挖掘站附近是個不錯的選擇，正如本教學中展示的這樣。

<goal>在稀有金屬資源點附近建造一座稀有金屬挖掘站，並將其連接在電網之中。

Text: Now that we have operational Shuttles it's time to establish a mining Dome.
Translation: 我們的穿梭機已經建造完成，是時候建造一座礦業穹頂了。

Text:
Once you have provided a Dome with living space, colonists from other Domes will be able to resettle in it, provided it is within walkable distance or there are available Shuttles to fly them there.

<goal>Construct a Living Complex inside the mining Dome.
Translation:
當你在穹頂中建造居住空間之後，如果穹頂在步行可及的距離內，或有穿梭機可以運送居民，其它穹頂中的居民就可以移居到這裡。

<goal>在礦業穹頂內複合式住宅宿舍。

Text: There are no Colonists in the mining Dome. We must provide living space for the Colonists so they can move there.
Translation: 礦業穹頂中目前沒有居民。我們需要為居民們提供居住空間，這樣居民們才會來到這裡。

Text: <goal>Select a Dome and open the Filter Screen from its Info Panel.
Translation: <goal>選擇穹頂，透過資訊面板開啟篩選介面。

Text: You can setup filters for every Dome to attract colonists with desired traits and block or push out colonists with undesired ones.
Translation: 您可以設定每個穹頂的篩選標準，吸引擁有需要特性的居民前往穹頂，禁止擁有不需要特性的居民進入，或趕走已有居民。

Text:
And because we want to make sure that the mining Dome gets all the available Geologists (which are best suited for work inside extractor buildings) we will also ban Geologists from inhabiting this Dome.

<goal> From the Specialization Category, activate the Thumbs Up icon for Scientists and the Thumbs Down one for Geologists.
Translation:
而且，我們希望所有的地質學家都能居住在礦業穹頂之中（地質學家最適合在挖掘站中工作），因此我們要禁止地質學家進入這座穹頂。

<goal>開啟專長類別，為科學家選擇支援拇指圖示，為地質學家選擇拒絕拇指圖示。

Text: This Dome has been designated for research purposes so it's best to attract more colonists with the Scientist specialization.
Translation: 這個穹頂專門用來研究技術，最好能吸引更多擁有科學家特長的居民。

Text:
And because we want to make sure that the research Dome gets all the available Scientists we will also ban Scientists from inhabiting this Dome.

<goal> From the Specialization Category, activate the Thumbs Up icon for Geologists and the Thumbs Down one for Scientists.
Translation:
另外，我們希望所有的科學家都能在研究穹頂中工作，因此我們要嚴禁科學家在這座穹頂中居住。

<goal>開啟專長類別，為地質學家選擇支援拇指圖示，為科學家選擇拒絕拇指圖示。

Text: Being near a Rare Metals Deposit, this Dome is best suited as a mining hub so it's best to encourage Geologists to migrate here.
Translation: 這座穹頂位於稀有金屬資源點旁邊，非常適合當做礦業穹頂，因此最好能鼓勵地質學家移居此處。

Text:
To demonstrate Dome connections, let's first build a new Dome near our research Dome.

<goal>Construct a Dome at the indicated location.
Translation:
為了實現穹頂連接，首先，讓我們在研究穹頂附近建造一座新的穹頂。

<goal>在指定位置建造穹頂。

Text: Colonists can migrate between Domes using shuttles or walking when they are positioned close to one another. However, they cannot usually visit buildings in nearby Domes on a daily basis, unless they are connected to their own Dome.
Translation: 殖民地居民可以透過穿梭機在穹頂之間移居。如果穹頂距離較近，他們也可以透過步行的方式移居。不過，他們是沒辦法每天都訪問附近的穹頂的，除非這兩座穹頂連接在一起。

Text:
Passages allow colonists to travel safely to Domes directly connected to their own, seeking work or services there.

<goal>Connect the Research Dome and the newly constructed dome with a Passage.
Translation:
殖民地居民可以透過通道安全前往與自己的穹頂相連的穹頂，以尋找工作或使用服務建築。

<goal>使用通道，將研究穹頂與新建好的穹頂連接在一起。

Text: Domes positioned closely to each other may be connected with Passages.
Translation: 位置較近的穹頂可以透過通道進行連接。

Text: Now that the two Domes are connected, colonists from the first can start working on the newly built farms in the third Dome. The Passage will also connect the two Domes for the purposes of distributing Power, Water and Oxygen.
Translation: 兩座穹頂已經連接在一起了，第一座穹頂中的居民可以在第三座穹頂的農場中工作了。通道不僅能連接穹頂，還能分配電力、水資源與氧氣。

Text:
All upgrades become available after specific technologies are researched and have construction costs. Furthermore, some upgrades will increase the resource consumption of the building.

<goal>Research the Extractor Amplification tech from the Research screen.
Translation:
只有研究了特定的技術之後才可以進行升級，升級需要耗費建築資源。不僅如此，一部分升級選項還會提高建築的資源消耗量

<goal>開啟研究介面，研究挖掘站增產技術。

Text: Some buildings can have upgrades that can improve them in various ways.
Translation: 部分建築擁有升級選項，可以從多個方面提高建築的效果

Text: <goal>Select the Water Extractor and then select the indicated Upgrade Icon.
Translation: <goal>選擇水資源挖掘站，之後根據提示選擇升級圖示。

Text: Congratulations - with the research complete, a new upgrade for your Extractors is now available. It is not automatically activated in your buildings, you must construct it first.
Translation: 恭喜，研究完成，您的挖掘站可以進行升級了。您的建築不會獲得升級效果，您需要先完成升級建造才行。

Text: Some Upgrades will consume more Power or Water while active. After an Upgrade has been constructed it may be turned On and Off from the same button that was used for its construction.
Translation: 部分升級效果在啟用時，會消耗額外的電力或水資源。升級建造完成之後，您可以透過點選同一個按鈕，選擇開啟或關閉升級效果。

Text:
It offers historical data for various colony metrics as well as overviews of Domes, Buildings, Colonists and transportation.

<goal>Open the Command Center and try it out.
Translation:
指揮中心可以提供殖民地方方面面的歷史資料，包括穹頂總覽、建築總覽、居民總覽與載具總覽。

<goal>開啟指揮中心，親自試試看吧。

Text: The Command Center is a treasure trove of information about the colony.
Translation: 關於殖民地各式各樣的資訊，都可以在指揮中心中看到。

Text:
The team at Mission Control is eager to meet you and serve under your command. The challenge of conquering Mars for the sake of humankind is still a tough one, but with a Commander as skillful and resourceful as you the task seems a bit easier now.

The colonization of Mars awaits! Good luck, Commander, and may the Cosmos be with you!
Translation:
任務指揮中心的團隊已經迫不及待地想要見您，想在您的手下服役了。征服火星對所有人類而言都是個艱鉅的挑戰。但有了像您這樣技術精湛、足智多謀的指揮官，這個任務似乎變得沒那麼困難了。

火星殖民指日可待！祝您好運，指揮官，願宇宙與您同在！

Text: Congratulations, Commander! You have graduated from the International Mars Mission training simulation!
Translation: 恭喜您，指揮官！您已經從國際火星任務局的模擬訓練中順利畢業了！

Old Text: Play Tutorials
Old Translation: 開始教學

Old Text: Skip Tutorials
Old Translation: 跳過教學

Text: Colonizing Mars is hard.<newline>Over 60% of all colonies fail even before a single human sets foot on the Red Planet.<newline>Several tutorials are available to familiarize you with Surviving Mars.<newline>Don't let the Red Planet defeat you! Play the tutorials.
Translation: 在火星上殖民絕非易事。<newline>之前建造的殖民地中，有60%在第一個人類踏上火星之前便已夭折。<newline>你可以進入教學部分，熟悉《火星求生》的遊戲系統。<newline>別被這顆紅色星球打垮！開始教學。
Old Text: Several tutorials are available to familiarize you with Surviving Mars. If you are a new player, consider completing the tutorials before your first game.
Old Translation: 您可以進入教學部分，熟悉《火星求生》的遊戲系統。如果您是新玩家，建議您在正式開始遊戲前先完成教學部分。

Old Text: Tutorials Available
Old Translation: 有可用教學

Text: You have active mods that may affect the tutorial in unexpected ways and result in an unplayable tutorial. We recommend disabling all mods before continuing.
Translation: 您啟用的部分模組可能會為教學帶來出乎預料的影響，從而導致教學無法完成。我們建議您在開始教學之前，關閉所有模組。

Text: Commander, some interesting readings are just in.
Translation: 指揮官，我們剛剛收到了有趣的資料。

Text: Things just took a turn for the weird.
What just transpired has left us speechless.
Translation: 剛剛發生的事情讓我們所有人目瞪口呆。

Text: Our Explorer just stumbled upon something fascinating.
Translation: 我們的探索者剛剛發現了某個奇妙的東西。

Text:
We didn't manage to complete the <challenge_name> challenge within the <challenge_sols> Sols limit.

As a great man famously said, failure is not fatal, it is the courage to continue that counts. Let's take this opportunity to learn from our mistakes and try again.
Translation:
在<challenge_sols>個太陽日內，未能完成<challenge_name>挑戰。

正如一位偉人所言，失敗並不可怕，可怕的是失去繼續堅持下去的勇氣。我們不妨藉此機會學習經驗教訓，然後再試一次。

Text: Sadly, we have failed this challenge.

Our mission should focus on a single objective: <challenge_objective>.

We have to accomplish this goal within <challenge_deadline> Sols or only <perfect_deadline> Sols for a perfect completion.
Translation:
我們的任務應集中於單個目標：<challenge_objective>。

我們必須在<challenge_deadline>個太陽日內完成此目標，或不超過<perfect_deadline>日內完美完成任務。

Text:
You have completed the <challenge_name> challenge for <elapsed_sols> Sols out of the <challenge_sols> Sols limit.

The score of our colony is <score>.

If you feel you can do even better, feel free to retry the challenge and complete the objective for under <perfected_sols> Sols for a perfect evaluation.
Translation:
您已完成<challenge_name>挑戰，僅用<elapsed_sols>個太陽日，目標為<challenge_sols>個太陽日。

殖民地得分為<score>。

如果您覺得您可以做得更好，可隨時再挑戰一次，以在<perfected_sols>個太陽日內完美地完成目標。

Text: Good work, Commander! Your colony has passed the challenge.
Translation: 指揮官，幹得漂亮！殖民地已攻克挑戰。

Text: Take a screenshot (overwrites any existing screenshot for this Challenge)
Translation: 截圖（覆蓋此挑戰的現有截圖）

Text:
You have perfected the <challenge_name> challenge for <elapsed_sols> Sols out of the <perfected_sols> Sols limit for perfect score.

The score of our colony is <score>.
Translation:
您已完美完成<challenge_name>挑戰，僅用<elapsed_sols>個太陽日，目標為<perfected_sols>個太陽日，並且獲得完美的分數。

殖民地得分為<score>。

Text: Congratulations are in order, Commander! Your colony has passed the challenge with flying colors.
Translation: 實至名歸，指揮官！您的殖民地已攻克挑戰，取得巨大成功。

Text:
The RC Explorer is a robust, yet complex machine. Those unacquainted would be astonished when they see the mission reports where dozens of minor breakdowns happened during an expedition and were ignored by the operators. Expedition veterans know that a dead light bulb won't break down the vehicle and they ignore it with a wry smile.

But when something as serious as the motor system breaks down, it takes bravery not to panic. There is no time for desperation then, our drones have to repair the malfunction before it causes more harm.

<effect>The RC Explorer suffered a malfunction. It has to be repaired by Drones
Translation:
遙控探索者是一臺堅固而複雜的機器。任務報告中會寫道一次探險過程中發生過數十次不嚴重的故障，而操作員直接將其無視。不懂的人看到這裡或許會感到十分驚訝。而探險隊的老手明白就算壞了一個燈泡，整輛車並不會拋錨。因此他們只是笑而不語地無視了這種故障。

但當發動機系統這類重要零件發生故障時，要保持冷靜是需要勇氣的。那時候沒有時間給你陷入絕望，我們的無人機必須儘快修復故障，以免其進一步造成危害。

<effect>遙控探索者發生故障。必須用無人機進行維修

Text: As with everything made by the hands of man, the Explorer isn’t without its breakdowns and failures.
Translation: 探索者是人造出來的，人類的一切造物都有可能發生故障。

Text: You’d think the Explorer had found buried treasure, the way our scientists were reacting. It was a sulfur-rich regolith!
Translation: 看到我們科學家的反應，你或許以為我們挖出了什麼寶藏。其實是找到了富含硫磺的風化層！

Text: The Explorer vehicle gathered various soil samples from far and wide around the Anomaly site and fed us the data. For hours, the telemetry was filled with buzzing chatter as the scientists at Mission Control discussed the implications of the element and made inventive plans about the future. The time of the expedition was limited and we urged them to make a final decision.
Translation: 探索者載具在異象地點附近大範圍區域中搜集了各種土壤樣本，並給我們發來了資料。任務指揮中心的科學家們花了數小時討論這些元素可能的影響，並給未來制定各種富有創意的計劃，通訊頻道裡他們的談話聲不絕於耳。探險的時間有限，我們催促他們做出最後的決定。

Text: Concentrate effort on gathering as many samples as possible. (<research(1000)>)
Translation: 全力搜集儘可能多的樣本。（<research(1000)>）

Text: Focus on geochemical analysis of the most Sulphide-rich samples. (Reduces the cost of Engineering techs by 10%)
Translation: 全力分析硫化物含量最高的樣本。（工程學技術成本降低10%）
Old Text: Focus on geochemical analysis of the most Sulphide-rich samples. (Engineering research boost: 10%)
Old Translation: 全力分析硫化物含量最高的樣本。（工程學研究加速：10%）

Text: Our initial spectrographic analysis confirmed it. Chromium. To find such a rich deposit of such a rare metal. Important was an understatement.
Translation: 我們最初的攝譜儀分析結果無誤。我們真的發現了鉻。鉻本身就是非常稀有的金屬，而我們居然找到了鉻儲量如此豐富的資源點。這次發現意義之重大難以言喻。

Text: The geological team couldn't wait to get their hands on the samples, but this was going to prevent the engineering team from smelting the materials for their ceaseless operations. The experts at Mission Control argued for hours, but the course of action was clear.
Translation: 地質團隊迫不及待想要拿到樣品，但這會導致工程團隊無法熔鍊這些物質以供他們各種無休止的建設工作之用。任務指揮中心的專家們爭論了幾個小時，但行動方針很明確。

Text: Study the Chromium deposit. (Reduces the cost of Engineering techs by 10%)
Translation: 研究鉻資源點。（工程學技術成本降低10%）
Old Text: Study the Chromium deposit. (Engineering research boost: 10%)
Old Translation: 研究鉻資源點（工程學研究加速：10%）

Text: Exploit the deposit. (deep Rare Metals deposit)
Translation: 開發資源點（獲得深層稀有金屬資源點）

Text: Someone joked we found kryptonite. It was because of the greenish-yellow hue of the beryl crystals.
Translation: 有人開玩笑說我們發現了氪石。這是因為綠柱石晶體帶有黃綠色調。

Text:
The contrast with the red Martian dust made them appear almost alien. Even if they wouldn't make any of the Colonists superhuman, they would surely give us almost supernatural powers!

Our plans at Mission Control included the introduction of a long-term nuclear energy solution for the growing Colony, and the Beryllium that we would produce from these minerals would be an immense help in this difficult mission. We would encase the nuclear fuel rods of our nuclear reactors in Beryllium and make a good use of its incredible mechanical, chemical and nuclear properties.

<effect>Reduces the cost of Physics techs by 10%.
Translation:
這種顏色與火星紅色的塵土形成鮮明對比，使其看起來幾乎像是外來物質。即使它們無法將殖民地居民變成超人類，但它們肯定能給我們近似超自然的電力！

任務指揮中心計劃用核能解決日益擴張的殖民地的用電問題，這是一項艱鉅的任務，而我們用這些礦物提煉出的鈹能給我們提供巨大的幫助。我們會將核反應爐的燃料棒包裹在鈹中，並充分利用這種物質極佳的機械、化學與核能特性。

<effect>物理學技術成本降低10%。

Text: The rover manipulators held the silver-white mineral up to the camera just as the chemical analysis came through. We’ve found Tellurium.
Translation: 探測車用機械臂將銀白色的礦物舉在鏡頭前，與此同時我們的化學分析結果也出來了。我們發現了化學元素碲。

Text:
In a moment, the Chief Engineer at Mission Control was at the communications station, urging instructions to the RC Explorer on how to handle and analyze the discovery. It was amusing to watch the almost childlike excitement in the eyes of the expert.

This is a significant discovery because it allows us to overcome an old problem in metallurgy. Easily-machinable metals allow for economical manufacturing of components, but the factors that allow it usually lower their performance, and vice versa. Thus, engineers had always been challenged to find ways to balance the two factors. The addition of Tellurium to iron alloys allows them to perform better in both areas.

<effect>Reduces the cost of Robotics techs by 10%.
Translation:
本來在任務指揮中心的首席工程師快步來到通訊站，向遙控探索者急切地下達處理與分析此次發現的相關指令。看著專家近乎孩童般興奮的眼神也是一件十分有意思的事。

這是一項意義重大的發現，因為它令我們能克服冶金學上的一個老大難問題。易用機器加工的金屬能讓我們以更低的成本製造零件，但往往會犧牲效能，反之亦然。因此，如何在這兩個因素之間取得平衡是工程師們一直以來面對的挑戰。往鐵合金中加入碲可令合金變得更易加工，還能提升其效能。

<effect>機器人技術成本降低10%。

Text: The probe’s drill had hit one hundred meters before it detected a spike in temperature. The data tells us it was ignited Magnesium compounds.
Translation: 探測器鑽頭在鑽探了一百公尺深之後偵測到高溫。資料顯示那是被點燃的鎂化合物。

Text:
We are still waiting for confirmation but the preliminary results are clear. There are signs of chemical burning, indicating a combustible material in contact with the probe. The mechanical friction of the drilling head must have ignited the magnesium. What a great discovery!

Scientists on Earth had long planned the creation of jet engines that could burn the carbon dioxide in the Martian atmosphere with the use of magnesium powder. With abundant amounts on site, the research teams could begin preliminary testing of a working prototype right away!

<effect>Reduces the cost of Robotics techs by 10%.
Translation:
我們依然在等待確認，但初步結果十分明確。有化學燃燒的跡象，這表明探測器接觸到了易燃物質。肯定是鑽頭尖端的機械摩擦點燃了鎂。這真是一項不得了的發現！

地球上的科學家長久以來都在策劃設計出能用鎂粉燃燒火星大氣中二氧化碳的噴射引擎。此地為我們提供了足量的鎂，因此研究團隊能立刻開始原型機的初步測試了！

<effect>機器人技術成本降低10%。

Text: We’ve just confirmed the location of a metal-rich deposit. A drilling accident turned to our advantage.
Translation: 我們剛剛確認了一處富含金屬資源點的位置。一次鑽探事故變成了意外之喜。

Text:
We lost a drilling probe while trying to analyze this Anomaly. The signal was suddenly lost and we got the tingling feeling that we would get lucky with the second one. The operators were extra careful and the second insertion revealed a vast network of underground cavities beneath the hard rock plate. On top of that, we managed to get in contact with the first probe which had fallen through in another section of the crust faults. We used the two probes as triangulation points for telemetry and pinpointed the location of the deposit.

The rover is still functional but it would take time before its locomotion systems are fully restored. The operators turned the defeat into a victory, devoting the unexpected time window to studying the magnetic properties of the Martian crust.

Text: We found some useful material in the debris from a small meteorite.

Text:

"The work resembles million tiny cylinders surrounded by flames. If you squint your eyes, the very static of the composition resembles a star map. The image is bordered by double rainbows while the work has an abstract feeling and a very dynamic structure."

Text: The readings told us it was a vein rich with ore, but the data turned out to be incorrect. Under those fine red sands lay the intact hull of a rover.

Text: We immediately recognized it – Curiosity. A historic finding that stretched its hand in a welcoming gesture through the years back to the first missions on the Red Planet. It belonged in a museum, but on the other hand was an opportunity to gain more parts that we could rarely get our hands on. It was a tough decision.

Text: The on-site data validates our predictive models of the electrically-charged dust devils.

Text:
Science is well aware of the causes of the massive Earth storms, monsoons and tornadoes and yet we never ceased to admire the primeval forces unleashed before our eyes. The same goes for Martian electrostatic dust storms. Our scientists already had a good working model on the behavior of these peculiar weather Anomalies on the Red Planet. Now we can refine this model even further. With the current expedition complete, we can confirm their theory, yet I doubt anyone would ever cease to revere the massive dust storms.

Text: The Anomaly turned out to be one of the most well-preserved asteroid impacts in our area. No geologist could ever put a price on it.
Translation: 異象原來是我們這片區域儲存最為完好的小行星撞擊區。地質學家一致認為這是無價之寶。

Text:
Earth scientists had long wondered about the effect of ancient asteroid impacts on Martian climate and geology. Several missions had been sent to gather data about these primordial events but the landers failed, as if the Red Planet wanted to keep some of its secrets for itself. Generations had to pass until we managed to send a successful expedition to lift the shroud of mystery.

With the data we gathered from the site, our colleagues on Earth will have material for years of research. Maybe we would finally find out whether the Martian core was shut down or it died out on its own, and we would be able to predict the destiny of our home world.

<effect>You gain <funding(800000000)> Funding

我們從現場蒐集到的資料足夠我們在地球上的同事研究好幾年了。或許我們終於能查明火星核心的熄滅是因為外因還是內因。我們還能預測故鄉地球的命運。

Text: We've just found Beagle 2. Or at least what’s left of it.
Translation: 我們剛剛發現了小獵兔犬2號。準確地說，是它的殘骸。

Text:
Over the years over two-thirds of the missions sent to Mars ended in disaster. The tragic course of events, attributed to bad luck, human error, or simply to the inevitability of shooting blind in the dark, had created a dark humor revolving around the Great Galactic Ghoul which feeds on exploration probes and the mystery of the Martian Triangle.

One of the best-equipped probe missions to Mars was Beagle 2, which failed dramatically in the last minutes before landing. Failed by the parachutes and the treacherous Martian atmosphere, the brave little probe crashed at fatally high speed against the red desert.

<effect>Reduces the cost of Robotics techs by 10%.

人類至今向火星發起了多次太空飛行任務，其中三分之二以災難告終。造成這一悲慘現狀的原因是運氣不佳、人為失誤或不可避免的盲目嘗試。因此，種種黑色幽默開始流傳，其中包括專吃探測器的“巨型太空食屍鬼”，以及神祕的“火星三角洲”。

在所有執行探索任務的探測器之中，小獵兔犬2號的裝備精良程度數一數二，只可惜這次任務在最後即將著陸時還是戲劇性地失敗了。降落傘的故障加上火星惡劣的大氣環境導致這臺勇敢的小探測器高速墜毀於紅色沙漠上。

<effect>機器人技術成本降低10%。

Text: Begin analysis on the crash site.
Translation: 開始對撞擊點進行分析。

Text: We’ve just found the wreckage of Phobos-2! The old probe even had some new data for us to analyze.
Translation: 我們發現了火衛2號的殘骸！這臺舊探測器甚至給我們提供了可供分析的新資料。

Text:
On July 7th, 1988 the Soviet Union launched two Proton-K rockets carrying the Phobos-1 and Phobos-2 probes on a course to Mars. Of the two craft only Phobos-2 reached its final destination, but contact with it was lost just before it could deliver its precious payload.

Humankind will be forever grateful for the information we salvaged from its computers.

<hint> Check the map for the new locations.

1988年7月7日，蘇聯向火星發射了兩枚質子K型火箭，上面分別搭載著火衛1號與火衛2號探測器。兩臺探測器中只有火衛2號最後到達了目的地，但在它即將傳送寶貴資料之時，地球與它失去了聯絡。

如果我們將它電腦中回收到的資料發回地球，那全人類將對我們感激不盡。

<effect>已發現若干處異象地點。
<hint>在地圖上查看這些新地點。

Text: Our Explorer just got into a pretty serious accident. The good news is it’s still in one piece.
Translation: 我們的探索者剛剛發生了嚴重的事故。好消息是它還能用。

Text:
The vehicle stumbled upon a crust fault which could have lasted for a couple hundreds of years under the slow erosion of the planet. Disturbed by the mechanical motion of the scanning probes, the surface opened like a wound and swallowed the rover, luckily, only for a dozen meters. The sturdy machine got out of the hole, but nevertheless it sustained heavy damage.

Millions of years ago Mars had been shaken to its core by cataclysmic impact which sealed the fate of the planet. Since then Mars, like all giants, is dying, too slow for our mortal eyes to witness. Yet even today the death-throes of the Red Planet can be felt unmistakably.

<effect>The RC Explorer has malfunctioned. It has to be repaired by Drones.
Translation:
載具偶然開上了一處地殼斷層，這處斷層或許已經經受了大自然好幾百年的緩慢侵蝕。地表由於受到了掃描探測器機械運動的干擾而像傷口一樣裂開，導致探測車陷了下去。好在它僅僅墜落了十幾公尺。這臺堅固的機器從窟窿中爬了出來，不過已嚴重受損。

幾百萬年前，災難性的隕石撞擊撼動著火星的核心，使這顆星球的命運成為定局。從那時起，火星和一切巨行星一樣，正在逐漸死亡，只是這個過程過於漫長，人類目睹不到它死亡的那一刻而已。但即使時至今日，我們仍能無比清晰的感覺到這顆紅色星球死亡的陣痛。

<effect>遙控探索者發生故障。必須用無人機進行維修。

Text: We’ve discovered a magnificent vista at the site of the anomaly.
Translation: 我們在異象地點發現了壯麗的景色。

Text:
Even after watching the cold splendor of the Red Planet for so long, Mission Control was awestruck by the beautiful footage provided by our intrepid reconnaissance vehicle.

<effect><reg_param1> new Applicants are available on Earth.

雖然我們已經對這顆冰冷的紅色星球上的景觀習以為常，但我們無畏的偵察載具傳回的這組瑰麗的影像依然令任務指揮中心裡的大家歎為觀止。

<effect><reg_param1>名地球上的新應徵者現已可供選擇。

Text: Let's hope we never tire of this beauty!
Translation: 希望這美景能令人百看不厭！

Text: We’ve collected valuable geographic data at the site of the Anomaly.
Translation: 我們在異象地點附近蒐集到了寶貴的地質資料。

Text:
Analysis of the crust yielded rare insights on the geological history of Mars, especially about the ancient Theiikian period, in which volcanic activity released immense amounts of sulfur dioxide in the atmosphere. Several key hypotheses of the exo-geologists were confirmed by our findings.

The scientific community praised the findings, raising the status of our mission in the eyes of humanity. Our sponsor committed additional funds to the mission.
Translation:
地殼分析提供了對火星地質史的寶貴見解，特別是古代硫酸鹽礦物時期。在這一時期，火山活動將巨量二氧化硫氣體釋放到了大氣中。我們的發現證實了外星地質學家的若干關鍵假設。

科學團體高度評價這次發現，我們的探索任務在人類心目中的地位也提高了。我們的贊助者為任務撥來了額外資金。
獲得2座無人機中心預製件。
獲得4座水氣蒐集站預製件。

Text: There were no secrets to find near the Anomaly site, just a scene of breathtaking beauty.
Translation: 異象地點附近沒有發現祕密，只有震撼人心的美景。

Text:
Such photo-ops have proven to be useful for the mission, inspiring people on Earth to believe that humanity should create its new home on the Red Planet.

<effect> A Celebrity Applicant is available on Earth.
Translation:
這樣的拍攝作業對任務十分有用，因為地球上的人們看到這樣的美景後會萌生出人類應該在這顆紅色星球上安家的信念。

<effect>一名地球上的名人應徵者現已可供選擇。

Text: Get up close and personal with Mars and you’ll find it’s anything but barren. We found another treasure in the form of a small deposit of a Germanium-rich mineral.
Translation: 近距離觀察火星，你就會發現它一點都不貧瘠。我們又找到一處寶藏，是一小塊富含鍺的資源點。

Text:
The purity of the Germanium found in the vein is amazing, which our scientific team presumes is due to the millennia-long loss of volatiles in the Martian atmosphere.

Germanium started out as the humble ekasilicon proposed by Mendeleev and for almost a century it was discerned as a useless metal, only for late 20th century discoveries to make it one of the cornerstones of modern electronics.

<effect>Discovered Rare Metals deposit.
Translation:
這個礦脈開採出來的鍺純度驚人，我們的科學團隊推測其原因是其中的雜質在千萬年的漫長歲月裡已揮發進了火星大氣。

鍺一開始被門得列夫稱為類矽，在近一個世紀的時間裡，它都默默無聞，人們視它為一種無用金屬。直到20世紀末，人們的一系列發現使其一躍成為現代電子學的基石之一。

<effect>已發現稀有金屬資源點。

Text: Until today, the only place we’d thought you could find Ice XV outside of a lab was on an icy planet or a moon. And here we find it. On Mars.
Translation: 我們至今仍以為離開實驗室後，只能在冰冷的星球或衛星上找到冰15。但我們今天在火星上找到了。

Text:
Ice XV is a super-dense phase of water ice which is formed in extremely cold and extremely high-pressure environments. It turns out that the unique geological history of Mars allowed a small quantity of Ice XV to form under the crust.

Even though we didn't confirm any substantial deposits of water, this discovery would cause uproar in the scientific communities and draw significant attention to our efforts on the Red Planet. Our sponsors immediately provided us with tools to discover more about the effects of Martian geology on the formation of underground ice.

<effect>Gain <funding(500000000)> Funding.
Translation:
冰15是一種密度超高的冰，形成於溫度極低、壓力極高的環境中。看來火星獨特的地質歷史令少量冰15形成於其地殼之下。

儘管我們尚未證實有豐富的水資源存在，但這個發現將會在科學界引起軒然大波，並引起人們對我們在這顆紅色星球上的工作予以高度關注。我們的贊助商立刻為我們提供了更多工具，讓我們進一步探索火星地質對地下冰形成的影響。

<effect>獲得<funding(500000000)>資金。

Text: We’ve analyzed material from the Anomaly and it completely validates our hypothesis on abiogenic petroleum!
Translation: 我們分析了異象中的物質，發現它完全驗證了我們對非生物石油的假設！

Text:
The pocket of natural gas we discovered deep among the hydrocarbon rocks was nothing short of an evidence of petroleum formation. The geophysicists here, at Mission Control, stare at the research data in disbelief. Mars, even in its alien nature, has proven once more a teacher in the mysteries so well veiled on our home world.

This unique opportunity allows us to gaze into the past of Mars and gather knowledge which would take months to simulate inside a laboratory.
Translation:
碳氫化合物岩石伸出找到的天然氣區域可以有力證明石油的形成。任務指揮中心的地球物理學家們凝視著研究資料，不敢相信自己的眼睛。火星雖然本質上是一顆外星球，但它再為我們揭開了地球上不解之謎的神祕面紗。

這次獨一無二的機會能令我們深入研究火星的過去，獲取到的知識足夠我們在實驗室裡花幾個月的時間進行模擬。

Text: Conduct on-site volatiles experiments. (Reduce cost of Physics research by 10%)
Translation: 實地進行揮發性實驗。（物理學研究成本降低10%）
Old Text: Conduct on-site volatiles experiments. (Physics research boost: 10%)
Old Translation: 實地進行揮發性實驗。（物理研究加速：10%）

Text: Conduct on-site polymerization experiments. (Reduce cost of Engineering research by 10%)
Translation: 實地進行聚合實驗。（工程學研究成本降低10%）
Old Text: Conduct on-site polymerization experiments. (Engineering research boost: 10%)
Old Translation: 實地進行聚合實驗。（工程學研究加速：10%）

Text: It’s not every day that we have the luxury to choose from what Mars has to offer.
Translation: 我們並非每天都擁有對火星出產的物資挑三揀四的特權。

Text:
The planet constantly reminds us of its old habit – to give with one hand and take with the other. The rover came across coffinite rocks rich in uranium, clustered on top of a rich hematite deposit. The mineral veins were positioned in such a manner inside the rock that we couldn't blast through without compromising some of them.

We faced a difficult decision, but at the end, it was a matter of simple pragmatics.
Translation:
這顆星球令我們時刻不忘它的積習，即它對我們付出時，同時也會取走我們的一樣東西。探測車在一處富含赤鐵礦的資源點頂部發現了富含鈾的水矽鈾礦石簇。礦脈位於岩石內部，我們若要炸開岩石，必定需要犧牲一部分資源。

我們面臨著一項艱難的決定，但從本質上說，只需考慮每種選項的實用性而已。

Text: Exploit the Hematite vein. (rich Metals deposit)
Translation: 開發赤鐵礦脈。 （獲得儲量豐富的金屬資源點）

Text: Exploit the Uranium vein. (Rare Metals deposit)
Translation: 開發鈾礦脈。（獲得稀有金屬資源點）

Text: We’ve found signs of native life!
Translation: 我們發現了當地生命的跡象！

Text:
The sensor reading from the Anomaly site provided the answer to one of the biggest mysteries about Mars. The Explorer examined a mineral cluster and found the preserved remains of microscopic life forms. We've managed to confirm that the deposit originated on Mars and not on one of the many asteroids that pockmark the surface of the planet.

The team is ecstatic with the find. If there was past life on Mars, perhaps we are not alone in the universe!
Translation:
異象現場的感測器讀數為火星的一個最大謎團提供了答案。探索者檢驗了一簇礦物，並發現上面儲存著微生物的遺體。我們設法確認了該資源點發源於火星，而非墜落到行星表面的無數小行星。

這個發現令整個團隊欣喜若狂。如果火星過去曾存在過生命，那也許我們在宇宙中並不孤單！

Text: Publicize the find as a triumph of the Mars mission. (<funding(choice_param1)> Funding)
Translation: 將這一發現作為火星探索的重大勝利向大眾公佈。（<funding(choice_param1)>資金）

Text: Publicize the find as a triumph of humankind. (<choice_param2> Applicants)
Translation: 將這一發現作為全人類的重大勝利向大眾公佈。（<choice_param2>應徵者）

Text: The odd composition of the debris collected from the anomaly site has proven to be an uncrackable riddle for our science team.
Translation: 從異象地點搜集來的這一系列奇特的殘骸令我們的科研團隊百思不得其解。

Text:
The experts all agree that the materials discovered at the Anomaly site could not originate on Mars, but they are also in agreement that they are not the remains of a meteorite or a contaminant introduced from our Rockets. For now it looks like the origin of the debris will remain a mystery.

As wise men throughout history said more than once: the more we know, the more we realize that we don't know.

<effect> A Genius Applicant is available on Earth.
Translation:
專家們一致認為此異象點發現的物質可能並不來自火星，但他們也贊同這些物質不是隕石殘骸，也不是我們火箭帶來的汙染物。就目前而言，這些殘骸的來源似乎仍是個未解之謎。

正如歷史上的智者不止一次說過的那樣：我們知道得越多，就越意識到自己一無所知。

<effect>一名地球上的天才應徵者現已可供選擇。
我最喜歡富有挑戰性的謎題了！

Text: We should research the Dark Spectrometry technology to learn more about the Black Cubes.
Translation: 我們應該研究黑暗光譜學技術以進一步瞭解黑色立方體。
Old Text: We should research the Dark Spectrometry technology to learn more about the Black Cubes
Old Translation: 我們應該研究黑暗光譜學技術以進一步瞭解黑色立方體。

Text: A peculiar black cube matrix has appeared near the Colony. We should send an Explorer to investigate.
Translation: 殖民地附近出現了一個很特別的黑立方矩陣。我們應該派一輛探索者前去調查。

Text: An unknown black, previously undetected cube-shaped object
Translation: 之前未偵測到的黑色立方體形狀的不明物體。

Text: Reportedly, a black cube has appeared within the extractor.
Translation: 報告稱挖掘站裡出現了一個黑色立方體。

Text: A Concrete Extractor went abruptly silent. Maintenance requests were met with nothing but static.
Translation: 一座混凝土挖掘站突然沒了動靜。回應維護請求的只有靜電干擾。

Text:
This event was unlike any malfunction predicted in the security protocols. Orbital scans on the site revealed no evidence of the existence of the huge structure – only a black cube matrix centered on the spot where the extractor was supposed to be.

<effect>A Concrete Extractor has been destroyed by a Black Cube. An Anomaly has appeared on the site.
Translation:
這種情況與安全協議中提到的一切故障都不同。對該地點進行軌道掃描並未發現這座巨型建築存在過的跡象，只看到一個黑色的立方體矩陣位於挖掘站之前所在位置的正中央。

<effect>一座混凝土挖掘站被黑色立方體摧毀了。該地點出現異象。

Text: A Black Cube has led to the destruction of a Concrete Extractor. We should investigate the site with an Expedition.
Translation: 黑色立方體導致一座混凝土挖掘站被毀。我們應該派探險隊調查該地點。

Text: Power of Three: A Black Cube Appears
A routine scan of the perimeter has detected an unidentified object within immediate proximity of the Colony. Data logs confirm it – it isn’t a glitch.
Translation: 一次例行周界掃描在殖民地附近偵測到一個不明物體。資料日誌證實了這次發現。這並非儀器故障。

Text:
The mysterious object appears to consist of pitch-black cubes arranged in a matrix. The cubes seemingly levitate above the ground without the aid of any support structure.

Preliminary image analysis remains inconclusive. An on-site investigation is required to assess the Anomaly. We advise caution.

<effect>A Black Cube has appeared seemingly out of nowhere. We have to investigate this Anomaly.
Translation:
這個神祕物體似乎由排列成矩陣的漆黑立方體組成。這些立方體似乎懸浮在半空中，且沒有任何支承結構。

對影像進行初步分析後，並未得出任何決定性結論。需要進行現場調查才能評估該異象。請謹慎行事。

<effect>似乎憑空出現了一個黑色立方體。我們必須調查此異象。
黑色立方體？真是件怪事……

Text: Power of Three: ...For, They Came in Numbers
The mysterious cubes continue to appear across the colony. Mission Control advises all personnel to remain calm and stick to protocol.
Translation: 神祕的立方體在殖民地各處不斷出現。任務指揮中心建議所有人員保持冷靜並按規定行事。

Text:
The cube structures tend to emerge without warning, as unscientific as it may sound, out of thin air. Apart from their evident presence, so far the structures pose no threat to the Colony.

Until further investigation, the scientific board of Mission Control has decided to impose an information blackout on the matter to prevent the spread of panic and fear among the Colonists.
Translation:
立方體結構很可能毫無徵兆的出現。雖然這麼說不太科學，但它們的確是憑空出現的。到目前為止，那些立方體只是靜靜地存在，尚未對殖民地構成任何威脅。

在進一步調查之前，任務指揮中心的科學委員會決定封鎖一切與黑色立方體相關的消息，避免引起殖民地居民的恐慌

Text: There is a certain sense of urgency to this, it seems.
Translation: 這件事似乎給人一種緊迫感。

Text: More than a hundred cubes have appeared. Their purpose and origin are still unknown.
Translation: 已經出現一百多個立方體了。我們對它們的意圖與來源依然一無所知。

Text: Power of Three: Making Sense of the Unknown
We can’t hide the truth from the public, not when the Colony’s being swarmed by black cubes.
Translation: 我們已經無法對公眾繼續隱瞞真相了，因為黑色立方體已經在殖民地裡到處都是了。

Text:
Without any credible explanation, the Colony was soon flooded with various rumors and interpretations of the mystery. What if they're bombs? Billions of tiny bombs? Or transport capsules maybe, with a mini robot inside. Or deadly hard drives. Or alien eggs? Or messages needing decoding. Or they're all parts of a bigger whole. Jigsaw puzzles that need to be put together.

The team at Mission Control is against trying to spread further misinformation and propaganda – partially because it would just add to the total confusion, but mainly because it would endanger the philosophical principles of our mission. We could only trust in our Colonists and hope for the best.
Translation:
由於我們無法給出什麼令人信服的解釋，殖民地裡充斥著這種神祕現象的相關流言與解釋。它們是炸彈怎麼辦？幾十億個微型炸彈。也可能是運輸艙，裡面搭載的是微型機器人。也可能是致命的硬碟。也許是外星人的蛋？可能是需要解碼的訊息。它們也可能是更大整體的一部分。就像拼圖的碎片一樣需要拼在一起。

任務指揮中心的團隊反對進一步散播有誤資訊與宣傳的行為。部分是因為那麼做只會令人們更加困惑，但主要是因為這種行為會危害這次任務的哲學原則。我們只能信任殖民地居民，並抱樂觀態度。

Text: We have to come up with something better.
Translation: 我們得想出更好的辦法。

Text: On-site analysis of the unidentified structure only deepens the mystery. The evidence suggests that the cubes are clearly not a natural phenomenon.
Translation: 對不明結構體進行現場分析後，這個謎團令我們越來越摸不著頭腦。證據表明立方體顯然不是自然現象。

Text:
The insides of the cubes as well as the physical forces behind their levitation remain an enigma. Individual cubes as well as their combined structure retain a perfect symmetry and any attempts to physically disturb their positions have failed.

What is even more puzzling is the analysis of the photonic spectroscopy of the cubes. They seem to emanate radiation of an unknown wavelength which excites the separation of electrons inside of the spectroscopic lens. While our science team refuses to jump to any conclusions, the Chief Engineer suggests that we should study the effect empirically on the Colony’s Solar Panels.

The science team requested permission to commence experimental research on the cubes' properties.

<effect>New research on the mystery of the Black Cubes is now available
Translation:
立方體內部以及它們漂浮所用的物理力仍是個謎。單個立方體以及它們組成的整個結構都完美對稱，任何打亂它們位置的嘗試都失敗了。

更令人困惑的是對立方體進行的光子光譜學分析。它們似乎放射出一種不明波長的輻射，這種輻射能激發光譜學透鏡裡的電子。雖然我們的科學團隊不願草率地下結論，但首席工程師表示根據經驗，我們應該研究殖民地太陽能板上的效應。

科學團隊請求對立方體的特性開始實驗性研究。

<effect>對黑色立方體謎團的新研究已開放。

Text: We should rearrange our research priorities.
Translation: 我們應該重新安排我們的研究優先順序。

Text: Primary analysis of the Black Cubes revealed no conclusive answers. The cubes may somehow affect our Solar Panels. New Breakthrough research is now available.
Translation: 對黑色立方體進行的主要分析並未給出什麼決定性的答案。立方體或許用某種方式影響著我們的太陽能板。新突破性技術現已可供研究。

Text: Recent orbital scans revealed a sudden surge of energy on site. It’s now evident that the cubes pose a far greater threat than blocking our infrastructure plans.
Translation: 最近的軌道掃描發現現場產生了突如其來的能量激增。現在看來，立方體構成的威脅顯然遠大於在阻礙我們的基礎建設計劃。

Text:
It appears the Black Cubes materialized inside the Extractor. We could only guess what happened to the building.

It seems any of the artifacts could materialize inside a structure, sending it into oblivion. We are now facing the potential threat of future human casualties.

Mission Control advises a top priority on the investigation of the disaster.

<effect>More buildings could collapse in the future. Preventive research is now available.
Translation:
似乎黑色立方體在挖掘站裡實體化了。那座建築物現在恐怕凶多吉少了。

似乎這種物體都能在建築物內實體化，並將建築徹底摧毀。將來發生人員傷亡也並非沒有可能。

任務指揮中心表示調查災難應是我們的當務之急。

<effect>未來可能有更多建築物倒塌。預防性研究已開放。

Text: A potential solution! This is great news.
Translation: 找到可能的解決方案了！這是個振奮人心的消息。

Text: We confirmed that the Extractor was destroyed by the Black Cubes. New preventive research is now available.
Translation: 我們已證實混凝土挖掘站已被黑色立方體摧毀。新的預防性研究已開放。

Text: Power of Three: A Time For Speculation
The latest research confirms that the cubes seem to be interfacing with each other. Almost like they’re forming some kind of device.
Translation: 最新的研究已證實立方體似乎正在相互連接。彷彿它們在組成某種裝置一樣。

Text:
The science team is divided in two camps: those who speculate it will amplify the cube signals allowing them to transmit through the reaches of space, and those who believe it could be some kind of weapon meant for destruction, not communication.

Outside the labs however, the cult of the Cubes has gained even more momentum. People are gathering to wait for what they think would be the coming of God to humanity’s second home.
Translation:
科學團隊分成了兩個陣營：一方猜測這種裝置能放大立方體的訊號，使其能傳播到太空中很遠的地方，另一方認為這是用來毀滅的武器，而非通訊工具。

然而，在實驗室外，立方教正在不斷壯大。人們聚集在一起，靜靜等待神降臨在人類的第二家園，當然這只是他們的想法。

Text: A culmination seems to be imminent, that’s for certain.
Translation: 可以肯定的是，事件即將迎來高潮。

Text: Power of Three: Solace in Science
We’ve applied the scientific method in every possible way to no avail. Time to try something else.
Translation: 我們用科學的方法進行了一切可能的嘗試，然而徒勞無功。該試試別的了。

Text:
In a moment of brilliance, or possibly desperation, one of the physicists proposed they should try to crack open the structures.

The scientists moved the cube matrix inside a non-baryonic shell and proceeded to bombard a single cube with high-energy ions, a process known as sputtering. The results were immediate – the shell of the cube gave in, resulting in its rapid decomposition. The matrix itself reacted to the influence by rearranging itself into a solid structure made of the remaining cubes.

Though we have no explanation for the process, at least we have a way to deal with the cube matrices popping up everywhere. It appears that the exact solution rests on our reason and moderation.

<effect>Cubes can be stored in special sites or destroyed
Translation:
一名物理學家靈光一閃（也可能是急中生智），提議他們應該設法打破結構體。

科學家們把立方體矩陣搬進了一個非重子外殼並開始用高能量離子轟擊一塊立方體，此工序稱為濺鍍。效果立竿見影。立方體的外殼支援不住，迅速開始分解。矩陣本身對此做出的反應用剩下的立方體將自身重新排列成一個堅固的結構體。

雖然我們無法解釋這一過程，但至少我們有辦法處理到處冒出來的立方體基陣了。似乎準確的解決方案取決於我們的理智與節制。

<effect>可將立方體儲存在特殊的地點，也可將其銷燬

Text: Piece by piece, we will unravel this enigma.
Translation: 我們將一步一步解開這個謎。

Text: Dark Spectrometry research completed. We can now store and destroy the cubes.
Translation: 黑暗光譜學研究完成。我們現在可以儲存與銷燬立方體。

Text: Power of Three: Embracing the Unknown
The mystery of the black cubes has consumed our Colonists completely. The reactions are as numerous as they are varied.
Translation: 殖民地居民已經完全陷入了對黑色立方體的狂熱中。對於立方體，無數人有無數種反應。

Text:
The Colonists have divided into factions centered around a certain hypothesis about the nature and purpose of the mysterious artifacts.

The excitement about the cubes is evident from the schedules of the weekly hearings in the Colony. The trivial themes such as the quality of the food and the requests for additional scientific funding had completely disappeared, replaced by requests for publicity for each faction’s viewpoint.

So far, there are three major camps. The moderate skeptics argue that the truth is hardly within our reach and cubes need to be preserved and stored for further research. The pessimistic ones insist on the destruction of all the cubes, seeing them as a deliberate threat. Then, there are those who hold the firm belief that the cubes are meant to be a gift to humanity from some unknown benevolent entity. They request the cubes to be transported inside the Domes and put on display for everyone to see.

<effect>Decoration Buildings made out of cubes can be constructed.
Translation:
殖民地居民根據對神祕立方體本質與意圖提出的假設分成各個派系。

從每週聽證會的日程安排就能看出人們對立方體的狂熱。食品品質、申請額外科學經費這類雞毛蒜皮的主題已經徹底消失，取而代之的是每個派系都請求將他們的觀點公之於眾。

目前為止，主要有三大陣營。溫和派的懷疑主義者認為憑我們是不太可能瞭解真相的，必須把立方體儲存起來，以供未來研究之用。悲觀派堅持將立方體視為威脅，並要求銷燬所有立方體。還有一派堅信立方體是某個仁慈的不明實體送給人類的禮物。他們要求將立方體運到穹頂內展示給所有人看。

<effect>可建造用立方體制造的裝飾性建築。

Text: A gift or a Trojan horse, I wonder...
Translation: 不知道這是禮物，還是特洛伊木馬……

Text: Decorations can be created from the Black Cubes.
Translation: 可用黑色立方體制作裝飾品。

Text: We are attempting to make some sort of sense of the laws that govern the cubes’ behavior. But it’s like trying to find a needle in a haystack. In a pitch-black cave. While blindfolded.
Translation: 我們正在嘗試理解主導立方體行為的法則。但我們毫無頭緒。就像在被矇住眼睛的情況下大海撈針一樣。

Text:
Still, our scientists managed to define to some extent why the cubes sometimes materialize inside our buildings. It seems that some cryptic algorithm first sends a pulse of tachyons to the area where the cube will materialize. If the Cherenkov radiation measurements are within certain limits, the cube appears on the spot. Thus, the cubes avoid appearing inside rocks – indeed, none of our scans confirmed that any cube spawned inside of a high-density object.

Our structures tend to be much less dense than the monolithic Martian rocks. We can modify our sensor towers to create a fake Cherenkov Effect by bombarding the areas around our structures with particles which are harmless to our Colonists, but would still prevent the cubes from threatening our Colony.

<effect>Sensor Towers now protect nearby buildings from the Black Cubes
Translation:
不過，我們的科學家依然設法在一定程度上解釋了為何立方體有時會在我們建築物內部實體化。似乎某種加密演算法會先將一道速子脈衝發射到立方體即將實體化的地方。如果契連科夫輻射度量處於一定極限內，立方體就會出現在該位置。這樣就避免了立方體在岩石內實體化的情況。而事實上，我們的掃描也從未證實有立方體在高密度物體內部出現過。

我們建築物的密度往往比巨大的火星岩石低得多。我們可以對感應塔進行改裝，以模擬出契連科夫效應，方法是用對殖民地居民無害的粒子轟擊建築物周圍的區域。

<effect>感應塔現在能保護附近建築物免受黑色立方體的破壞。

Text: A small victory – our efforts continue.
Translation: 這是一次小勝。我們再接再厲。

Text: S.H.E.P.I.D. research completed. Buildings within range of our Sensor Towers will be protected from the cubes.
Translation: S.H.E.P.I.D.研究完成。感應塔範圍內的建築不會遭到方塊的破壞。
Old Text: S.H.E.P.I.D. research completed. Buildings within range of our Sensor Towers will be protected from the cubes
Old Translation: S.H.E.P.I.D.研究完成。感應塔範圍內的建築不會遭到方塊的破壞。

Text: We should research the S.H.E.P.I.D. technology to protect the Colony structures from the Black Cubes.
Translation: 我們應該研究S.H.E.P.I.D.技術來保護殖民地建築免受黑色立方體的破壞。
Old Text: We should research the S.H.E.P.I.D. technology to protect the Colony structures from the Black Cubes
Old Translation: 我們應該研究S.H.E.P.I.D.技術來保護殖民地建築免受黑色立方體的破壞。

Text: All cubes on Mars have started to pulsate, counting towards an unknown event.
Translation: 火星上的所有立方體開始有規律地發光，預示著未知事件的發生。

Text: Within the hour all the cubes across the Colony started emitting light pulses, sending a wave of panic across the Colony. Even here at Mission Control we found it hard not to worry.
Translation: 一小時之內，整個殖民地裡的立方體都開始發射光脈衝，導致殖民地陷入恐慌。就連在任務指揮中心的我們都憂心忡忡。

Text:
The photovoltaic effect we observed earlier has completely disappeared. To make things worse, numerous glitches in the drone command software have our technicians scattering to extinguish fires all across the board. It seems that the pulses from the cubes are somehow interfering with the Drone uplink.

As reports are flowing in, we can clearly see a trend in the intensification of the light pulses. Is this some kind of countdown? And if so, to what?
Translation:
我們之前觀察到的光點效應已完全消失。更糟糕的是，無人機指揮軟體發生了無數故障，導致我們的技術人員無法集中一處，而是四處滅火。似乎立方體的脈衝正以某種方式干涉無人機的上行鏈路。

不斷湧入的報告向我們清晰地表明瞭一點：光脈衝越來越強。這是某種倒數計時嗎？如果是，那倒數計時結束後會發生什麼？

Text: Just colonizing a new world isn’t interesting enough, it seems.
Translation: 看來單單在外星球殖民還不夠有趣。

Text: Power of Three: Of Mice & Men
Our Colonists want decisive action in dealing with the cubes.
Translation: 我們的殖民地居民要求立刻決定處理立方體的方法。

Text: Some of them call for the immediate destruction of all the cubes while others still insist on storing and studying them – as far away from the Domes as possible. And yet, the number of eccentrics worshiping the cubes and erecting monuments with them has grown even larger. Could the cubes be affecting us like they influenced our drones?
Translation: 有些人要求立刻摧毀所有立方體，還有些人依然堅持儲存並研究它們，只不過得先把它們運到儘可能遠離穹頂的地方。然而，崇拜立方體並用其樹立紀念碑的怪人也越來越多。立方體是否會像影響無人機一樣影響我們呢？

Text: Looks like we're fighting the cubes for the control of our drones. And we are losing that battle.
Translation: 看來我們正在與立方體爭奪無人機的控制權。而且局勢對我們越來越不利。

Text:
Between their usual command cycles, the drones have begun carrying cubes to a specific location and seem to be constructing a strange structure.

Diagnostics on the drone software and hardware reveal no clues for any reprogramming. All of our attempts to gather information about the purpose of this operation have failed.

Mission Control advises all personnel to brace for the unknown.

<effect>Some Drones are constructing a mystery building with the cubes.
Translation:
無人機會在它們通常的指令週期間插入將立方體運至一個特定地點的指令，並似乎在建造某種怪異的建築。

對無人機軟硬體的診斷並沒有發現程式被篡改的跡象。我們蒐集此現象相關資訊的嘗試都失敗了。

任務指揮中心建議所有人員為未知情況做好準備。

<effect>有些無人機正在用立方體建造神祕建築物。

Text: At least our Drones aren't attacking us yet.
Translation: 至少我們的無人機目前還沒有攻擊我們。

Text: Affected Drones are building something of alien design.
Translation: 受影響的無人機正在建造某種外星建築。

Text: Drones influenced by the cubes have started the construction of a Mega Monolith.
Translation: 受立方體影響的無人機已開始建造超大型紀念碑。
Old Text: Drones influenced by the cubes have started the construction of a Mega Monolith
Old Translation: 受立方體影響的無人機已開始建造超大型紀念碑。

Text: Once completed, the monument emitted a pulse of all-encompassing energy and we all experienced a single collective dream! Or memory?
Translation: 完成後，紀念碑會發射出一道吞噬一切的能量脈衝，我們所有人都會體驗同一個夢境！也可能是記憶？

Text:
Eons ago, while Earth was still a molten world, Mars had already been a teeming, living world covered by oceans and forests. This long-forgotten Mars was the home for a sentient race which quickly mastered their primitive urges and reached technological peaks yet to be conquered by humankind.

We witnessed the astonishing evolution of the Ancients and the countless metamorphoses they experienced until they reached a state of existence which allowed them to transcend the boundaries of the material form. Without worrying about resources or lifespan, they traversed the universe, leaving their home behind. But they have not forgotten it.

The robust Black Cubes lay in wait on the Red Planet for a meeting of the minds. Our actions here were detected by the semi-sentient algorithm which controlled the cubes and triggered the message left by the Ancients. Some of the accounts given by our personnel describe being talked to in a language both familiar and thoroughly alien, while others describe being shown images most vivid and influencing. Some would even account for experiencing a sort of judgment. The essence of the information was, however, without exception, the same.
Translation:
億萬年前，當地球還是個熔岩星球時，火星上已經被海洋與森林覆蓋，是個生機勃勃的世界。這顆早已被人遺忘的火星是一個智慧種族的故鄉。這個種族很快擺脫了原始與愚昧，攀登上了人類尚未達到的技術高峰。

我們目睹了這個遠古種族令人驚異的進化與經歷過的無數次變形，直到他們達到了超越物質形體束縛的存在狀態。不再需要為資源或壽命發愁的他們離開了故鄉，在無邊的宇宙中漫遊。但他們並未忘記故鄉。

堅固的黑色立方體在這顆紅色星球上等待著文明碰撞之日的到來。控制立方體的半智慧演算法偵測到了我們在火星上的活動，並觸發了遠古種族留下的消息。殖民地裡有些居民稱外星人用一種既熟悉又陌生的語言與自己對話，還有人稱看到了栩栩如生而震撼人心的畫面。甚至還有人稱經歷過了某種審判。然而，資訊的本質無一例外都是相同的。

Text: The Ancients were pleased to see we had reacted with restraint and curiosity, trying to understand the unknown phenomenon instead of fearing it.
Translation: 遠古種族對我們十分滿意，因為他們看到我們對未知現象的反應是保持克制並以好奇的心態設法理解，而非盲目恐懼。

Text: Judging from their own history, they assume this was not necessarily an easy thing to do. They recall the fondest epochs of their history, where such strivings were predominant amongst them. Proud and nostalgic, they offer us a gift. Gained a new Technology,
Translation: 他們根據自己的歷史判斷要做到這一點並非易事。 他們回想起了最美好的時代。那時，他們中大部分人的做法與我們相同。自豪而思鄉的他們給了我們一件禮物。 獲得新技術，

Text: We communed with the Ancients in our collective dream. They were impressed by our curiosity.
Translation: 我們在共同的夢境中與遠古種族進行了溝通。我們的求知慾深深打動了他們。

Text: The Ancients were set back by the hostile reaction we had towards their messengers – the cubes.
Translation: 我們對遠古種族的立方體信使做出的敵對反應阻礙了他們的計劃。

Text: Ultimately they expressed understanding, noting that there were times in their own long history, dark times when they had the same hostile response towards the unknown. They hope that with time and maturity we will come to embrace the idea that while the universe is a dangerous place, not everything is a threat and there are also wonders to be discovered. All Black Cubes have disappeared Gained a new Technology,
Translation: 但最終他們對我們的行為表示理解，因為他們自己漫長的歷史也經歷過黑暗的時代，那時他們面對未知也做出過同樣的敵對反應。 他們希望我們會隨著時間的流逝慢慢成熟，並接受一個理念，即雖然宇宙中危機四伏，但並非一切事物都懷有敵意，也存在著等待探索的奇景。 所有黑色立方體都已消失。 獲得新技術，

Text: We communed with the Ancients in our collective dream. They were somewhat surprised by our hostility against the unknown.
Translation: 我們在共同的夢境中與遠古種族進行了溝通。我們對未知事物表現出的敵意似乎令他們大吃一驚。

Text: The Ancients were intrigued and quite surprised by our choice to indulge in creations of art with their cubes.
Translation: 我們用立方體進行藝術創作的選擇令遠古種族十分驚訝，並引起了他們的興趣。

Text: Oblivious to the concept of higher powers, they seemed to see no other reason for our actions other than a pursuit of aesthetic decoration, one that seems to have eluded them as a possibility. Not quite sure what to make of this, they express hope we will retain our creativity as a race in the ages ahead. The monument collapsed into a pile of Black Cubes Gained a new Technology,
Translation: 他們並不理解更高等存在的概念，於是認為我們這麼做唯一的理由是對美學裝飾的追求，似乎他們之前並沒有想到還有這種可能性。 他們不確定該如何理解我們的行為，只是希望我們這個種族在未來的日子裡不要丟掉這份創造力。 紀念碑坍塌，變成了一堆黑色立方體。 獲得新技術，

Text: It has been quite the ride.
Translation: 這一切都太不可思議了。

Text: We communed with the Ancients in a collective dream. They were impressed by our creativity.
Translation: 我們在共同的夢境中與遠古種族進行了溝通。我們的創造力深深打動了他們。

Text: Power of Three: Out of the Eons
The moment the last cube fit in the structure, we detected a single, intense beam of high-energy particles directed towards the cosmos. What could it mean?
Translation: 最後一個立方體嵌入建築物後，我們偵測到一道巨大的高能量粒子束射向了茫茫宇宙。這意味著什麼呢？

Text:
Meanwhile, reports from all over the Colony indicate that all cubes have ceased their pulsating and reverted to their previous lifeless state. Many Colonists report to the medical facilities that they feel different states of depression – ranging from melancholy to outright despair. Could these events be attributed to the mysterious structure and the death of the cubes? We would never find out.

<effect>All Colonists suffer penalties to Morale.
Translation:
與此同時，殖民地各處都報告稱所有立方體停止了脈動，並變回了之前的靜止狀態。很多殖民地居民向醫療設施報告稱他們感覺到了包括憂鬱和絕望在內的程度不等的壓抑情緒。這些現象會不會和神祕的建築以及不再活動的立方體有關呢？我們永遠也不得而知了。

<effect>殖民地全體居民士氣下降。
或許我們當初本該多付出一些努力。

Text: We didn't get to the bottom of the mystery of the Black Cubes. Perhaps more decisive action was needed.
Translation: 我們沒能查明黑色立方體謎團的真相。也許我們需要採取更果斷的行動。

Text: <red>The mystery of the Cubes remains unresolved</red>
Power of Three: For the Generations to Witness

Translation: 我們不能對立方體視而不見。

Text:
It would be irresponsible to mismanage the situation and leave public opinion to sway back and forth on the matter.

With the current state of events we lack sufficient data to judge the purpose of the cubes. It could take years if not generations of scientific research to reach a conclusion on that subject. Until then, we will attempt to control the erratic spread of the cubes which hampers our resources and colonization operations by storing them away in a convenient manner.
Translation:
對這件事處理不當是不負責任的行為，我們不能讓大眾對此事的態度搖擺不定。

目前，我們擁有的資料仍不足以對立方體的意圖做出判斷。要得出結論或許需要幾代人花費數十年的時間進行科學研究。在那天到來之前，我們會設法將這些方塊以便利的方式儲存起來，以防止它們繼續不規則的蔓延，並耗費我們的資源，同時妨礙我們的殖民任務。

Text: Only time will tell if we are right.
Translation: 只有時間能判斷我們的做法是否正確。

Text: Power of Three: Might Makes Right
The primary goal of our mission is the permanent colonization of Mars. Any potential threat to humanity’s pioneers is to be eliminated.
Translation: 我們這次任務的主要目標是在火星進行永久殖民。因此必須消除一切可能威脅到人類先行者的因素。

Text: We will attempt to remove all the cubes from our immediate area. A decision as serious as this required a consensus, which was reached through a vote at Mission Control. The public may deem this decision wrong, but we cannot place the fate of the entire Colony on our desire to wait it out. History had taught us that the inability to act often results in disaster. The destruction of cubes will proceed as planned.
Translation: 我們會設法銷燬周邊區域內的一切立方體。這種重大的決定需要所有人達成一致，而任務指揮中心已投票通過了這一決定。大眾或許會認為這個決定是錯誤的，但我們不能因為自己想靜觀事態發展而拿整個殖民地的命運冒險。歷史教會了我們：不作為往往引起災難。我們會按照計劃銷燬立方體。

Text: Humanity will prevail, no matter the cost.
Translation: 我們必須不惜任何代價保障人類的利益。

Text: Power of Three: Cult of Tomorrow
The idea that we are not alone in the universe and could become part of a bigger whole has swept over the Colony.
Translation: 我們在宇宙中並不孤單，且可能是更大整體的一部分這一理念席捲了整個殖民地。

Text:
To disregard the desires of our Colonists would be a monstrous, autocratic act.

Mission Control has officially allowed the creation of a series of monuments dedicated to the Higher Truth proclaimed by some of our most active Colonists. We must look into ourselves and at our history as a species – denying the possibility that these people are right would mean that we are no better than the fanatics who burned visionaries at the pyres because of their beliefs.
Translation:
對我們殖民地居民的願望置若罔聞會令我們與惡毒的獨裁者無異。

任務指揮中心正式允許居民建造一系列紀念碑。我們殖民地裡最積極的居民稱這些紀念碑將獻給更高層面的真理。我們必須審視自身以及人類的歷史。這些人觀點正確的可能性是存在的。否認這種可能性就意味著我們和那些將遠見卓識者因擁有自己信仰而活活燒死的狂熱教徒一樣愚昧無知。

Text: It would be tyranny to forbid this.
Translation: 封殺這種思潮將令我們變成暴君。

Text: The argument was that hindering the construction of the Mega-Monument would give us enough time to prepare for any possible risks. The argument was wrong.
Translation: 我們之前的觀點是妨礙超大型紀念碑的建造可為我們爭取到足夠的時間，以為一切可能的風險做好準備。這個觀點錯了。

Text:
The obscure algorithm or – perish the thought! - the intelligence directing the construction has commanded otherwise. Within mere hours, the super-structure dematerialized, decaying to its basic components, and reappeared, commanding our drones to proceed with its construction anew.

The creators of the structure definitely want us to finish their plan. The potential risk from yesterday has now become a tangible menace and I don't believe that anyone in the Colony lives under the illusion that it is avoidable.

<effect>All Colonists suffer Sanity loss due to the threatening behavior of the Mega-Monument Construction.
Translation:
令人費解的演算法 - 錯了，是指揮建造工程的智慧體下達了別的命令。短短幾小時內，超級建築化為了構成它的基礎原料並消失，然後再次出現，同時命令我們的無人機重新開始建造工作。

建築物的創造者肯定想要我們完成他們的計劃。昨天潛在的風險變成了實實在在的威脅，我相信殖民地裡沒人還抱有能避免這種威脅的幻想。

<effect>超大型紀念碑建造期間發生的異常現象威脅到了殖民地，導致全體居民理智度下降。

Text: Ominous news. We must be ready for anything.
Translation: 這是個不祥的消息。我們必須做好萬全的準備。

Text: Meteors incoming from the Koronis asteroid cluster are about to intercept the Earth and Mars orbits.
Translation: 來自鴉女星小行星群的隕石即將穿越地球和火星的軌道。

Text: The Dredger that lands excavates something from the planet's surface. Sending an expedition crew to analyze this location will shed light on the Dredgers' behavior.
Translation: 降落的挖掘機從星球表面挖掘出了什麼東西。派出探險隊分析此地點將解釋挖掘機的行為。

Text: A Dredger excavated something at this position and then took off. Sending an expedition crew to analyze this location will shed light on the Dredger behavior.
Translation: 一臺挖掘機在此地點挖出了某種東西，然後離開了。派出探險隊分析此地點將解釋挖掘機的行為。
挖掘機挖掘現場：阿爾法

Text: Send an expedition to observe and examine the landed Dredger to boost our Dredger Morhpology tech
Translation: 派遣一支探險隊觀察並檢測著陸的挖掘機可加快我們挖掘機形態學技術的研究速度

Text: Mission Control, we’ve received the preliminary report from the landing site expedition. The RC Explorer is on-site, awaiting further orders.
Translation: 任務指揮中心，著陸區探險隊給我們發來了初步報告。遙控探索者就在現場，等待進一步命令。

Text:
From the spectroscopic data gathered from afar, we know that the object is covered in a robust crust of silicates and metal despite its organic appearance. The tentacle-like protrusions are inanimate and it seems they serve as support columns for the main structure. The operators reports no activity from the object except its continuous excavation – it is either inanimate or it pays no heed to our presence in the area.

The RC Explorer operator requests permission for close inspection on the object.
Translation:
遠距離蒐集到的光譜資料顯示，儘管物體看起來像有機物，但其表面包裹著堅固的矽酸鹽與金屬外殼。形似觸手的凸起物沒有生命，看起來似乎是主要結構的支撐柱。挖掘仍在繼續，期間操作員報告稱該物體沒有任何活動的跡象。要麼該物體沒有生命，我們在該區域的存在沒有引起它的注意。

遙控探索者的操作員請求近距離查看該物體。

Text: Negative. The risk is too high.
The Explorer completed the close inspection of the Object without any major problems.
Translation: 探索者完成了對該物體的近距離檢查，期間未發生任何重大問題。

Text:
The rover ventured within mere meters of the Object and conducted a series of field tests and observations on it. We scanned it with radiological and spectroscopic equipment and extended a remote probe to its carapace, gathering tiny samples of its crust. Via its telescopic arm a camera and sonar were inserted within the Object, revealing a perplexing maze of cavities and corridors inside. A close inspection below the Object shows that it digs a hole beneath itself through a rotation of its frontal hull and extracts metal-rich ores, but its position above the ground level remains the same. The RC Explorer operators report no response from the Object during any of these operations.

The data we've gathered is already sent to our sponsor via encrypted transmission. We are sure the commission will value our efforts greatly.

<effect>You've gained <funding(reg_param1)> Funding and <research(reg_param2)>.

<hint>The Object extracts resources from below the surface.
Translation:
